The glass screen is not easy to scuff or scratch, but protecting it preserves the pristine condition & the resale value. Belkin F8M164eb is durable, masks fingerprints, diffuses ambient light, reduces glare, but also clarity, especially of the crispiest screens, due to the matte finish and the increasing accumulation of the invisible fingerprints. It is easy to remove without a residue left.

First, read the instruction and clean the surface. Tape the protector's edge (the clear backing down) to the surface edge with an alignment strip or a substitute. Flip the protector over the attached edge, lift the protector's backing starting from that edge, and roll the exposed sticky protector's back over the surface slowly covering it with the aid of the edge of the cardboard packaging or a short ruler. Applying light pressure initially allows easy peeling back for corrections, as the adhesive is sensitive to pressure.
target: Durable, masks fingerprints, diffuses ambient light, reduces glare, but also clarity

This Verso brand Prologue Antique Case for the Kindle Fire HD 7\\" is just gorgeous, especially if you like the \\"old school\\" library look and feel. The picture of the cover does not do it justice. It is much prettier and finer in person. This is made out of \\"animal friendly\\" faux leather and has a hand distressed finish, beautiful embossed embellishments, and antique foil stampings.

The inside of the cover is lined in microfiber and has e patent-pending silicone-enhanced corner elastic straps to hold your device in place.

This is also a \\"certified \\"Made For Kindle\\" product, so you can be sure that it will fit the product it is specified to fit.

As stated the battery life is not the best but i still get a average of 3-3.5 hours of life without having to have the screen super dim while not gaming, My guess running off the battery and gaming will drastically lower that. input: We bought three of these tablets for our kids for Christmas and within 2 days two of them were out of commission. Before they stopped working, the kids really liked them, although I noticed the screen cut off some websites and the interface wasn't very intuitive.  The wi-fi connection was easy and they were cheap, but they all went back to the store and we ended up paying a bit more for more durable, reliable tablets.

I absolutely love this case. Here are some comments I have for it based on a month of owning it:

- The bezel on the back of the case provides an ergonomic grip for the tablet.
- The extra weight from the case feels negligible even during long periods of using the tablet.
- I like the concave cutout for the speakers. The sound projects forward as advertised.
- The material of the case feels nice.
- I toss my iPad instead of gently placing it on hard surfaces because I know the case will protect it no problem.

I purchased my Kindle for an extended trip to Germany to see my daughter. I found the directions for using it were easy and clear and I had no problems downloading books.  I flew to Atlanta for my connecting flt. and used it while I was waiting to board. I stored it in my Kindle case and put it in my purse. I stowed my purse behind my feet on the floor but not within the range of anyone who could step on it. About 2 hrs into my 9 hr flt. I took it out to use it and my screen was broke! I was SO upset! I don't know what happened to it. It was not sat on or treated roughly, or dropped but the screen is destroyed. When I return to the states I will be sending it back. My son has had one since Christmas and has had no problems with it. I guess I just got a lemon. I hope they will send me a new one, but sadly I can't use it for my return flight.  Bummer!

Pros: Tough case, good grip for holding(not slippery), seems to protect everything well, easy to install

Cons: Very minor, but the screen sensitivity on the edges is impaired because the screen protector is not flush with the ipad screen. This is easily fixed. I bought a two pack of Tech Armor glare and fingerprint resistant screen protectors off Amazon for less than $10 and put them on the ipads. Then using a utility knife, I peeled off the Griffin's screen protector, but I also carefully cut around the part of the Griffin with the front facing camera so it would remain protected. A little extra work and a couple bucks, but a fairly bombproof/kid proof cover with excellent screen sensitivity and reduced glare.
target: Tough for kids and easy to handle...but best when modified.

I just love this sort of pointing device. less wrist movement, fine control etc.
People fall into 4 camps for pointing devices.
> don't care /mouse users.
> touch screen/ touch pad users.
> index finger track ball users.
and
> thumb track ball users.
This is for that last category of people . This trackball works decent at a range, and works great on the desk- no cables to get in the way and small usb dongel. Cleaning the ball and socket is easy and intuitive. Multiple falls from desk height to the floor and it still works well (as long as you don't loose the ball!). And, in my experience, easy on the batteries (maybe 2 or 3 times a YEAR at most with using it 8+ hrs a day 5 days a week).

I had problems with this device out of the box.  The first problem I had was that software does not take you through a setup process.  I turned on the device and it immediately sets up a RAID 0.  It should ask you how you want to configure your device.  The second problem I had was that the device went into an \\"EM Mode\\". I called Buffalo and they directed me to update the firmware on the device. I did follow their instructions.  It fixed the \\"EM Mode\\" but then I started to get an I/O error.  The other thing I saw was that the web interface was now in Japanese.  After 8 hours of trying to get setup I figured I needed to stop.  In my opinion, if you start off by calling tech support to fix the product you pretty much need to stop and return the item.  I consider it being broken and not ready for prime time.

The case proved to be a neat compact solution and snugly, I'd also add precisely, fit my Kindle and turned it into a neat easy to carry along packet. The keyboard mated via Bluetooth to my Kindle without trouble. It works very well and produced no problems.

What I discovered, however, and thought you should consider, is that while handy and does offer a larger more type-able keypad, I have so far not found a situation where I could easily set up the keyboard/tablet combination and use it to great effect. The entire system is too small for me to arrange and type anything more than a few lines.

Therefor, I suggest that while this combo is neat and useful, you may want to consider passing up the inclusive keyboard package for a case without one and then, should you still require a keypad, shop for one that is closer to standard size.

The concept of paper books needs to change: think of all the resources that are used in making and distributing a paper book which many times then sits on a shelf for most of the rest of it's life.  Millions of copies doing the same thing: gather dust.  This is the future!

Acer builds a very nice machine at an extremely affordable price. As more and more of the computing experience moves to the cloud, the value of this Chromebook only increases.

I carry a lot of gadgets with me when I travel and anything that adds bulk is not OK in my book. This case is so lightweight you won't even notice that your tablet weighs any different.

I have used this for 2 days now - the first day I ended up borrowing a friend's Microsoft wireless mouse (which worked flawlessly) because my 2 hour old Kensington was falling apart (there are 3 magnets inside holding the case together, 2 of mine came off the first day). I glued the 2 magnets back on that night, and the second day was better, but after using it for about 15 minutes, it would start flaking out and I would be unable to select anything on the screen. I ended up borrowing a friends Logitech wireless, which also worked flawlessly. Now I liked the idea of this one - mainly the slim profile so I could slip it in my pocket, but the construction is cheap and the performance is unreliable. Both the Microsoft and Logitech mice were clearly of higher quality construction. I don't know which one I'm going to buy but this one is destined for the trash bin. I forgot to mention that the wheel rubs against the plastic, so when I use the wheel, I have to hold it slightly to the left just so it will rotate, again - cheap construction.

I got the E4200 router to replace my aging WRT54GS router.  I may be going back to the old one!  The E4200 has issues - every few days it loses its Internet connection.  It seems the only way to recover from this is to shut down the cable modem for a few minutes and then start it back up.  After searching the Cisco forums I found that this is a very common problem with the E4200 which started with firmware version 1.0.02.  The latest version, 1.0.03 which I am running, still has the issue. According to posts on the forum, people are going back to firmware version 1.0.01 which apparently does not have this problem.  I guess I try that next before I start to look for a new router!  It's very disappointing that Cisco has not addressed the issue considering the number of people that have posted about it!
Clunky. Process for updates is awful. Worst computer I've purchased.

Instead I got rid of this and used this [[ASIN:B0058NN1A0 Biostar USB 3.0 Aluminum Front Panel CABLEUSB30 - Black]]. input:
Worked as expected until today, when my computer announced that the battery could not be recognized and could not be charged. Disappointing to say the least. The battery was quite hot at one end. At least it didn't burn my house down.

UPDATE:
An hour later, after the battery cooled down a bit, fairly normal function seems to have returned. Don't know how long it will last, but it is recognized and charging at the moment. I should also add that the rubber feet on battery, which keep it from scratching the table beneath them, came off within the first 3 days of use. Clearly shoddy glue used. So, add $2.50 for some superglue, which has kept them attached since.

Leaving the review at one star for now. If I'm still using the battery in a month--and my house hasn't burned down--I'll upgrade it to two stars.

input: When my Roku 1000HD died, I decided to replace it with the Apple TV.  There seems to have been no thought to features in the photo category by the designers.  There is no setting to allow you to display a full frame.  The result is that if your camera has a typical 4:3 aspect ratio, you will lose a significant part of the picture.  The box arbitrarily pans across part but not all of the photo to compensate.  There is no zoom as on my old Roku either so you can't get to just a part of the photo.  Some of the TV features are nice to have but as other reviews noted, the HDTV standard requires full 5.1 sound.  Let's hope there are some software fixes to this box soon!    (Revision:  The goofy zoom and pan is actually the default \\"Ken Burns Effect\\" and can be turned off.  That does get you the full picture on Landscape photos but not on Portrait.  No \\"help\\" and no documentation comes with the box though - so easy to overlook this!  Very user unfriendly!  Also, it has no \\"OFF\\" Switch  quite the little energy pig.)
target: It's a dog for displaying your photos!

input: On window 7 the installation couldn't have been easier.  Installed the software from the disk in less than 5 minutes, clicked on the windows internet access icon, put in the the network password, and connected immediately.  This unit replaced a Linksys WUSB600n receiver  which was plagued by disconnections. I've used this one for two days with zero interruptions and, it appears to carry more bandwidth than the Linksys device gave me.
Considering how long it takes for my Kindle to charge through the USB port, this was amazing.  I wouldn't give it up for anything.
I will need my son's assistance in using this. Right now I don't have Wi-FI at home which I know i need.

I ordered the keyboard made for the 2nd gen Nexus 7 (2013). The first picture shows the nexus 7 being used in portrait mode on the keyboard. However, the only way this works is if you put the nexus 7 upside down into the slot, since the charging port is a little too big to fit in the slot. And once it's in portrait mode, the keyboard + tablet combo WILL fall over unless you constantly hold the keyboard. If you let go, the tablet will tip over. Otherwise, when used in landscape mode, this keyboard is pretty nice. Easy to pair with the nexus 7, and all the keys are working. Alt+tab even works to select a recent application. I'm using CM10.2 nightlies, instead of stock rom, no problem.
target: Nice, but portrait mode is a little misleading

input: Great mouse for the price! Slightly smaller than a regular sized one so its perfect for portable use with a laptop. Not too small though like some I've used

I recently replaced my old desktop with a Mac Mini, and set up the old tower as part of a desk/workspace to tinker with. I decided to try this adapter out to have internet on the old machine again, and it truly was a plug-and-play experience. After the initial driver download, it was up and running and I connected to my home network with no problems and an excellent signal (from the other side of the house). Glad I bought this, and while I haven't had the need to deal with Mediabridge customer service, I have been pleasantly surprised by the support they offer as far as follow-up email (after placing the order to address any immediate concerns) and from other reviews here on Amazon. Great, super easy-to-use product at an incredible price.

Monster is the king of hype. \\"High-purity copper?\\"  Give me a break.    Oh, and if you are using this adapter for line-level signals (such as driving a headphone) then there is no reason to have to \\"shield\\" the signal.  Unless, of course, you are working in the transmitter shack at the base of an AM antenna tower.    Maybe not even then.
Amazing:-)

The HD is great, fast and easy to use, but the temperature of the drive is really hot, it's clear that the design din't take into account the use of the HD in a room without A/C. With an ambient temperature of 28 C, the drives SMART reports 59 C, and this temperature the drive will not last very long.

I put a Notebook cooling pad fan on top of the drive an the temperature is now in 46 C, now I'm looking small 40mm fan to permanently install them to the HD casing.

Real shame that Seagate didn't include some form of temperature management other than passive vent holes.

I have an older Seagate Desktop USB 3.0 drive and the temperature is similar but lower.

I bought this to hack out the Cam for another project, it is a nice little board Cam that is easy to get out of the case without damaging the Cam.  There are 6 bright white LED's mounted to the board with the Cam, they can be easily disabled as they have a separate  power lead ( gray ). There is a push button switch (N/O) for taking stills that can be snipped off as well.  Keep in mind that it is a 5 volt Cam and exceeding that will fry this Cam!  The little fold out ring on the base allows you to hang the Cam on the top of your monitor. Some reviewers seemed to wish that this unit had IR LED's thankfully that is not the case since this unit is to be pointed at your face. Recent research has shown that IR light directed into the eyes can lead to cataracts!   I found almost no time lag in the video, this effect may be due to limited memory or the way your software handles the images. I could not find a similar board Cam for less than $20.00 so this is a great bargain.

input: It's cute and fits the kindle well, but I can't get the keyboard to work.  It's like it needs to be charged, but there's no charger or place to plug it in. I like this skin. It's a bit cheaper than some of the others out there, but looks every bit as good. It's sturdy, easy to apply, and seems to do a decent job protecting my Kindle 2.

My only complaint is that the vendor gets a pretty good amount of money for shipping, only to mail it first class for about the cost of a postage stamp. If they don't profit from the shipping fee, I'd be surprised. I understand Amazon doesn't have a way to drop it any lower, and so I give them the benefit of the doubt, but for what we pay in shipping they could step up the shipping to 2nd day or Priority Mail and still turn a profit, consider the size and weight of this item.

Still, it's a good item, and the other decal companies charge too much for shipping, too... So it's all fair, I guess.

And it just looks dirty, even though I don't touch the inside. And I have to clean it most of the time to get an appealing look, but it never looks \\"new\\" it looks disgusting, and \\"oily\\" and I don't know why it came like that. I also got little black spots all over the case. Don't buy this product. Read the bad reviews first, because my mistake was I believed the good ones.

Just because I'm a bit anal in that if I have a PC case that supports a certain size of a fan, I've got to have them. That's why I bought these 140mm fans. To replace the 120mm fans I previously had installed. One thing I noticed swapping fans out was the 120mm fans would make a distinct noise running on their lowest setting that my fan controller would let them. These new Cooler Master fans eliminated that noise. Good solid fans for the price.

I love this keyboard. It's thin, not bulky. It's got nice sized letter pads that aren't raised up high, so typing is much easier on the fingers and wrists. More like a laptop keyboard. However I find that changing the volume on the monitor is tedious with having to go through the menus on the monitor every time I want to change it. Also there is a dead pixel (just one), that I find bearable but annoying, right in the middle area of the screen.

I purchased this graphics card in April of 2011 in order to upgrade my existing decent HP PC that I had. I purchased this card, upgraded my power supply, and was up and running.

The card is large, so hopefully you have a mid or large sized case ready for this guy since you don't want heat to be too much of an issue.

I can run most games at medium to high settings and they all look great and run smooth.

It's almost time for me to build an entirely new PC and I'm considering just keeping this card since it is so decent.

Edit: February 2014 - still have the card in my PC and it works really well. Able to run games at decent settings even after nearly 3 years.

First off, I had not noticed that the charger had dual USB ports when I first saw it. When I received it, it was in two separate packages. I thought that was nice. I thought the charger was the problem from my RCA 7" tablet from Wal-Mart but, it is actually the inside port from the tablet. So, if you are purchasing this to replace your tablet charger, I would just try and return the tablet first because most reviews I read warned me that it was not the charger but in fact the port on the tablet but I bought it anyway. I will still find a use for it because I have several chargers that disconnect from the base. I also thought about just using it with my car inverter and letting it stay in the car so that I wont have to move the chargers from the house. All in all i have had it for a few weeks and find it very sturdy and expensive looking.

The Good: This flash drive is by far my favorite! The speeds are incredible, and it is tiny and rugged! I think it's at a great price point, and it performs really well.

The Bad: This flash drive is great, but when you use it for USB 2.0, the speed is extremely slow! I have the same flash drive, but only USB 2.0, and it is much much much faster than this one when trying to use it on USB 2.0.

Overall: This is a great flash drive, and if you are mainly going to be using it for USB 3.0, GO FOR IT! You won't be sorry!

Though I'm old school, and like a physical book for studying my teaching subject or for reading the Bible, this gizmo is pretty handy for a great many reasons.  The most outstanding is that I can download a new book title (assuming that it is offered by Amazon in Kindle format) in just a few seconds...wirelessly!!  The book will be in my Kindle literally (using the word correctly) before I can log out of Amazon and back into my e-mail.  A second quality is that it is easy to transport just about anywhere and the battery lasts quite a while...you know how many times you have to sit and wait for the doctor,  in the airport, or while your wife is shopping...in 3 or 4 seconds after hitting the on button you're reading from the page where you left off.  I'm sold on the thing.

This thick cable charges my new cell phone. The Samsung Galaxy Note 3. Took hours to figure out this solution. I wish they would stock the 3ft alternative. 6 ft is to big to carry around.

This cable does not work on my portable battery. I have the EZOPower 11000mAh 5-Port External Backup Battery Portable Charger Plus Carrying Case. However, the Samsung cable did charge it.

So in summation, don't waste your money buying a new charger. THe old micro usbs work fine with this. If you want the cable for faster speeds and faster charging, than it is fine pluged into walls.

Comes with decent software and is fast! Hard to beat at current pricing.

If you want slimmer, more portable, very solid construction, and can accept half the capacity (500GB) -- check this out -- also attractively priced: [[ASIN:B009C97GNE ADATA DashDrive Elite 500GB HE720 Slimmest Profile USB 3.0 External Hard Drive (AHE720-500GU3-CTI)]]

The mouse works fine the first time around but after about 3 months when it is time to change the battery, the battery replacing procedure fries something on the circuit board so the mouse stops working.

I have tried EVERYTHING for the past week to get it back up and running from something so simple as a battery change but it does not work and Microsoft support is useless.

After opening up the mouse to see what the problem might be (since I know my way around electronics), there are signs of corrosion.

DO NOT BUY. Most of these reviews are from people who have not used it very long.

Also, don't just take my word for it. Do a google search and you'll see many other complaints about the mouse \\"not connecting\\" or \\"not working\\" anymore.

This is my second replacement battery from this company and you can't beat the performance for the price; you could purchase approximately 4 of these for every 1 Apple brand battery. The battery fit is acceptable; if the slight alignment mismatch is an issue for you, then purchase an Apple unit. My daughter purchased an Apple unit, and the alignment is not any better than this unit, so price/performance is the only comparison at hand and this unit wins, no question! Don't forget to re-set the PCM when you swap the battery (remove the old battery with the laptop off; press & hold the power button for 5 - 10 seconds, and proceed with installing the new battery). Additionally, charge the battery only when the battery power level is low. Lastly, calibrate your laptop battery at least once a month by using the computer with the battery low until it goes to sleep and won't wake; let it sit and run down until it shuts off; then charge the battery completely in one sitting. I get about 3 hours per battery charge and any battery that I have lasts at least 3 years.

My  PC sprang to life and was fully booted, Internet ready in ---  15 seconds instead of 4 minutes !!!  I began hunting around for anything that might be missing - well there was nothing missing .  It had cloned the old hard drive perfectly right down to the hidden partition to run a system recovery to the original factory settings.  I am positively ecstatic with this purchase . I would highly recommend this drive for anyone wanting an incredible performance boost to their PC .

I love my HP 17" Pavilion laptop, it is a workhorse and travels everywhere with me, but as things do the OEM battery finally stopped taking a charge and I had to find a replacement for an "obsolete" part.  I replaced the original 8 cell battery with this 12 cell, and it has been a perfect match!  I followed the instructions for charging and completely depleting the battery a few times and it has taken and held a 100% charge since.  With the additional cells the battery profile has added about 3/4" to the bottom of my laptop.  This actually works out nicely because it raises the back of the laptop slightly and makes the angle of the keyboard more comfortable (for me) to type on and gives a little more airflow for the fan to ventilate the unit.  The price point for this battery was a significant bonus, as the the HP version (if you can find one) is upwards of $70.  All things considered, this was the right purchase for me, and if I'm still using this laptop when this battery wears out, I would purchase again.

After being slightly apprehensive about purchasing ANY charger/sync cord for my GTab2, because of the decidedly mixed reviews that seemed to accompany virtually all of those I researched, I 'pulled the trigger' on this particular product. . . and was NOT disappointed. NO problems so farand I ddon't anticipate any as the quality appears to be 'top notch'. I may even order another to have on hand as a third back up to this one and the original that came with the Tab2.
I'm starting a new job soon and will be on the road, A LOT, and I hope the other tech items I need to acquire to make my job easier are of the same calibre. I purchased a Plantronics Blutooth headset as well and will be reviewing it after some 'field testing', but so far, so good.
Thanks, Amazon.

input:
Works like a dream. I use a Lenovo Z510 Laptop, wanted to get rid of the stock 5400rpm Hard drive because it was the only thing holding back the overall performance. I popped this bad boy in, booted from a windows 8 install disc and it fired up with ease.
tl;dr:
1. Its FAST. Boots in less than 10 seconds and programs are just as fast (64bit versions of photoshop and illustrator both open within 15 seconds or less)
2. Its quiet. The only thing I hear from my laptop now is the fan. But of course, its a Solid State so that's expected. I'm just not used to it.
3. Its lightweight and small and easy to install. Pops right in.

Overall I love this product. No problems whatsoever. We'll see if it stands the test of time though.

input: Having a Cf USB 2.0 card reader made life much more simpler than transfering images via the Camera.  There are 2 big advantages in buying one.  1) It is powered by your Computer via a USB cable and does not require you to upload via your camera, so you can save your camera's batteries.  2) It transfers images from the CF to the PC at a significantly faster rate than the camera. Without keeping track of time I would say it is 2/3 rds quicker with a CF reader than using a conventional usb transfer via the camera.  My only regret is that I did not buy this product sooner.
target: Works like a charm. Super fast image transfer

The unit works well for my use, but since I don't have another unit to compare against, I can't say that it is better or worse than its competitors.  It does have dual antennas which presumably improves its signal strength.    I am using this unit in bridge mode.  The hardest part of the setup was finding the instructions.  The general setup instructions assume that one is going to use it as an access point, presumably to add wireless access to a non-wireless router or to add N capability to an A, B, or G router.  My only other complaint is that the unit has only a single ethernet port.  To connect more than one piece of equipment, one has to use a switch, so the only advantage I see over a gaming adapter is the dual antennas.

input: I needed to elevate a monstrous HP DV8 laptop, which has an 18.4 inch screen. This seems to be the only stand on the market that can accomodate something over 17 inches wide. It is very sturdy and well-built. A neatly tucked USB cable is built in and is the primary means of connecting the wireless keyboard and the USB Hub. Only inconveniences: a) the stand is up or down and not fully adjustable; and b) the stand blocks the front of the laptop preventing IR remote access on mine.     The keyboard is well-above average, with ample wrist rest and multi-media functions. It has all the necessary functionality (including volume control and video/audio playback functions), along with good signal reach and low power consumption (I haven't changed the batteries yet, after two months use).     Overall, this is a solid buy. I couldn't be happier. Just add a mouse and you're good to go.

Bought this device because (a) the price finally dropped to below $200 and (b) I was about to go off on 2 weeks vacation.  Enjoyed the reader during the vacation (camping on Cape Breton Island in Nova Scotia) both as a reader and as a wireless web browser (\\"experimental\\") -- this was first vacation in years on which I did not bring a laptop.  Location was remote and outside the coverage area on the map, but I was still able to (just barely) access Gmail and Red Sox scores.  Also tried subscribing to New York Times and Boston Globe, which worked OK (though not my cup of tea for normal times.)    Main complaint I have is:  my home in Vermont is outside Kindle (ATT) wireless coverage area -- total dead zone -- and transferring content to the device via PC/USB is a moderate hassle.  On my return from vacation, I found that the latest Kindle model -- at the same price -- has *WiFi* in addition to WhisperNet access, which would be ideal for home use.  ::sigh::
target: Awesome reader, wish I'd waited a few weeks

The rating has nothing to do with the product quality.  I bought this card from an individual versus one of the main stores.  Make sure you can find the serial number on the CF card when you open it.  If you cannot find one, guess what?  You got a fake.  Some cheap card with the Extreme sticker on it.  Other things to look for:  Was there a hologram on the box?  Was the plastic casing sealed shut or were you able to pull it open with no effort?  But definitely look for the serial number!

input: Belkin makes good products. This case/cover is another example of the thought and care they put into the things they make. The exterior of the cover is a durable leather-like material while the interior is very soft and luxurious. It feels like brushed suede but is actually a man-made made material.The iPad (both the new version and the 2nd generation) is held securely in place in all four corners by fairly large L-shaped pieces of the cover material sewn to narrow elastic straps. These overlap the corners by nearly three-quarters of an inch but don't interfere with the screen. There is a wide elastic strap on the cover that can be slipped over the closed case similar to a Moleskin notebook. This keeps the whole thing tidy when it is put in a bag or briefcase. The cover is made so that it can fold backward out of the way completely when the iPad is in use. Nicely made, nice looking, too.

I am running dual monitors (F-419 and a 17"CRT)on windows xp with 64mb 8Xagp video.  The difference between the two is astounding.  The black on the CRT isn't black anymore after comparison to the F-419.  I have read multiple places that CRTs are superior for gaming.  But based on what I have in front of me I would have to say the F-419 would hold up.  I have done some recommended ghosting tests to see what type of ghosting occurs on the two monitors and I actually saw more on the CRT than on the F-419.  I cannot recommend this monitor enough, plus it looks great and it is super light.

(1) The caddy fits into the bay fine but does not have any screw tab to secure it into the bay. So the only thing holding it in is the connection between the caddy and the motherboard. Nothing has happened so far but it is something you need to watch for.

input:
This equipment is living at the top of a sailboat mast in Georgia, serving at an access point for marina guests. It has handled multiple connections from various WiFi devices without any complaints.

Update after 6 months in service ************************************

Rock solid reliability as an access point and now reconfigured to serve as a client router.

My only complaint is that the admin log in password only stores 12 characters. This is an undocumented feature as far as I can tell. It is easy to enter a password longer than 12 characters when updating the log in password and then not be able to log in to the admin page. If this happens, try entering the first 12 characters of the password you created. Otherwise the only fix is to climb the mast and reset the device.

Another Future: Poetry And Art In Postmodern Twilight is an anthology of critical essays about contemporary poetry, art, culture, and politics by independent scholar and poet Alan Gilbert. Divided into three sections, \\"Considering How Material Documents Can Be\\", \\"Territories and Other Forms of Knowing\\", and \\"Meaning Politics Without Regrets\\", Another Future questions the social context of modern poetry and charters a discourse for thinking about contemporary culture in terms beyond post-modernism. A scrutiny so meticulous as to resemble a documentary, Another Future is especially recommended reading for students of modern poetry.
target: An anthology of critical essays about contemporary poetry, art, culture, and politics

We are using these drives on our production with a Red Epic.  We're shooting about 7 pages a day on an 11 hour day.  We use two drives per day with one for the master and one for the backup.  The drives run well in the field and in the office.  Their small form factor makes them very portable.  There is no excess heat during use.  They are sufficiently rugged although we have excellent cases and handle them with care.  We are shooting at 4k and find we are ingesting upwards of 700 to 800 GB per day.  Firewire works sufficiently fast that we're close to transferring to master and backup by the time crew is wrapped.  I will continue to use these drives throughout our 14 day project.

It took me less than 2 minutes to pop off the old and replace with the new and now I'm enjoying being able to transfer large amounts of data (800 GB) at much faster speeds. I saw some reviews that stated theirs didn't come with any cables, I can report that mine came with a cable and and a new power supply for what that's worth.

I use this primarily at home and will use a different cover with more padding and protection when I travel, but this is my favorite especially in the preppy pink and green!

The Kindle allows me to carry my whole reading list wherever I go so that I can start reading whenever the mood strikes me without having to carry more than one light weight item.  Thank you, thank you, thank you.
target: The best idea in years for frequent travelers

input:
Very solid product. I was amazed that on initial boot up I was prompted to import the settings from my Surface Pro 2! I agreed and everything imported including an app I use quite a lot. The scary part was that it included my IE Browser history as well. Not that that presents a problem but from a privacy concern it was surprising. And i know there is an IE setting to preclude this, but just a cautionary note.
I got the I& 256Gb version and am impressed with it's speed and the graphics are impressive. I very much like the 12" screen over the SP2.
the only down mark so far is that twice I have had problems booting up. Black screen maybe the cursor displays (50% so far) but nothing else. On line research got me the hard reboot sequence (hold power for 30 sec, release for 15 sec, hold power + Volume for 15 sec).

I have always loved the Kindle simply because it made it easier to read. Not carrying books around is a real plus.
A month ago my original Kindle 3g finally let me down and I was secretly happy, because I could get one of the newer devices. Fire maybe?
Went to the website to order and noticed the kindle tech chat button. Less than twenty minutes later after a couple of tests, the person on the other end said, "We can send you a new one." What? Awesome! three days later had a brand new Kindle 3g and couldn't be happier!
Amazon and Kindle have never failed me and I will sing their praises to any who will listen. Thank you.
target: Love the Kindle in all it's forms, but you cannot beat Amazon's service!

It seemed great at first, but fast forward 6 months later and the two I bought both randomly snapped. I bought the two pack for my bf and I. He just complained last week that his has snapped off and got stuck inside his ipad. Then today I picked up mine and pulled it out, it hadn't snapped off, but the metal plug part had come loose from the base and when I touched it after removing it, the end fell off. This was not user error. Neither of us had done anything to cause it. And neither of us has had this happen to any other iPad charger before.

Sadly 99% of review users leave their reviews very soon after receiving the product, which is really only helpful if there are no reviews at all to go by. But, obviously, those reviews will not gauge how well a product holds up over time. If I had reviewed this immediately upon receiving, or any sooner than last week, I would have given it 5 stars like so many others here have.
target: Did not hold up after 6 months

I did not carefully read the tech specs in the detailed product info. This will NOT CHARGE an iPad Mini. Read the tech specs carefully. This is a hub only. I can transfer photo files from my iPhone 4S and Canon SX 50 easily to my Mac Air. No problems there. I have never connected more than two devices through this hub. It is so lightweight that I cannot leave it permanently connected because it flips around and causes problems. If I am careful, I can have my Le Cie Porsche connected and backing up at the same time that this is connected. I will use it to take with me around town, but for my work desk I am going to purchase the http://www.amazon.com/EasyAcc®-Charging-Smartphones-Specially-Included/dp/B00MLVTL88/ref=cm_cr_pr_product_top  Look at the video reviews for that product and read the tech specs and you will see that it is a superior product for daily use.

input:
This router was a breeze to get working. I was able to get it set up easily using a Mac through the web interface. You can access the web interface by connecting to the router via an ethernet cable and then going to 192.168.1.1 in your web browser. The manual explains how to connect to this web interface.

I haven't had any problem with signal. It's more than adequate for streaming videos (on Netflix, Hulu, YoutTube, etc.), which is the most bandwidth-intensive activity I do. I can't vouch for the signal range as my living space is quite small. So far I've had three devices simultaneously use the wireless without a hitch.

I'm totally satisfied, especially for the price.

He reads every night for approx 30-45 minutes using the light, but having the wifi off, and he charges the unit about every 9-10 days. Actually he still has about 25% of the battery still available but he doesn't drain it all the way before charging. He only turns the wifi on for a short time each day just to update the Kindle then he turns off the wifi, doesn't make sense to keep on 24/7 since that also uses battery life.
Being a former Nook user, I am very impressed with the Kindle e-ink readers and plan on purchasing another one for a family member that is also a Nook user. This person saw our Kindles and was overjoyed with the battery life as well as the convenient size. Our family reads a lot and prefers e-ink readers, we just wish we really checked out the Kindle before purchasing the other brand.

input:
If your plan is to buy this card, attach it to a laptop, and then attach it to a GoFlex USB 3 Hard Drive, prepared to be disappointed. This card does not provide enough power on its own to run USB hard drives. Although it comes with a cord that allows for additional power to be provided to the card from a spare USB port on your laptop, something about the power output causes the drive to simply stop working after a while. I initially thought it was my supplemental USB port turning off power, so I tried an external power source that I knew would not turn off and had the same result. Tested the same drive using USB 2.0 directly, and no issues.

This appears to be an OEM card that has multiple brands, and is based on the Renesas USB chip, so I suspect any of the cards that look exactly like this one and use the same driver will have the same result. Works for probably 5-10 minutes, then stops. Very disappointing.

Bought this for a new ST2000DM001 Barracuda 7200RPM 2 TB SATA 6 GB/s NCQ 64 MB Cache 3.5-Inch Internal Bare Drive. Nice, cheap (<$17) performance upgrade to extend the life of an aging (and heretofore unreliable) ASUS PC.

input:
Pleasant surprise that this product actually works. You plug one adapter into an outlet near your router, run an ethernet cable from the adapter to the router. Plug the other adapter into an outlet near your computer, run an ethernet cable from the adapter to the computer. Enjoy.

Just don't plug into a surge protector as the speeds get nerfed substantially. Only directly into wall outlets.

I usually don't write reviews, but if I can prevent someone else from wasting their money, it will be worth it. I bought this item back in December, and it has already stopped working (now the end of June). I am a current medical student, and take care of my purchases. My computer, which I have had since 2008 (as well as this now useless hard drive) always stay on my desk. My room has full A/C and the item has never been dropped, nor has it gotten wet.

I back up my Mac laptop every couple of weeks and today the process didn't work. The hard drive makes a "clicking" sound when I plug it in to any power source, and it no longer registers on my Macbook or my roommates PC. Looking online, this seems to be a sign of hard drive death. As a student I don't have $50 to spend every half year to keep my documents safe. I will never purchase another item from this company.

I can't over emphasize this enough...gestures (both keystrokes and touchpad) will be ignored by the system.

2) The display automatically dims itself at odd times (even when plugged in) stays that way.

If you are a web-surfer or using this recreationally, you'll likely not notice these issues. If you are a technical professional, the combination of a zenbook with windows 8 is a inexcusably poor showing...

input: This is a nice solid mount for a 2.5 inch drive.  But, if you have a quality case that uses rubber insulated mounts for the 3.5 inch drives, you won't be able to use your normal drive mount screws for this bracket.  In my case, the 3.5 inch drive are mounted by passing the screws through rubber grommets in the frame that holds the drives.  The threaded holes in this bracket are non-standard - not threaded the same as the mounting holes in the typical 3.5" drive.  So, you are forced to use the screws that come with this frame, but, they have very small heads and are too short for the grommets.  All this could have been avoided it they had just used the standard mounting screw size and threads.

For what you get, this case is pretty phenomenal.

Although it's a little rough around the edges concerning fan quality, everything else about this case is pretty top notch.

Although I had read that the front \\"Handlebars\\" aren't to be used as such, it wasn't until I saw it on how disappointing that situation is. It's not a terrible ordeal though

Case does not have good wire management. It's a little tight if you're trying to get optimum airflow.

For modding, you won't find a more solid case to start chopping up.

The only annoyance is that the double-ziplock seal is very hard to close. It's not easy to line them up perfectly and you have to seal two rows before folding and snapping down the top. This takes long enough that for a bath I usually just snap one row - I've never dropped it, after all, I just use it to guard against steam and splashing.

So it's not something you can just casually drop it into and out of, but once you've got it on it does a good job.

input: I ordered this for use with my Win 7 64 bit machine and others.  The product spec sheet says it is compatable with \\"Windows 7.\\"  Without clarification I believe most people would interpret this as being 32 and 64 bit versions.  When the product arrived, I saw that the System Requirements on the box state \\"Windows 7 (32 bit).\\"  Online tech support has just confirmed that the iConnect does not work with Win 7 64 bit.  In case you are unaware, Win 7 32 bit is limited to 3 gigs of RAM. We just bought an inexpensive laptop with 64 bit & 4 gigs for just over $500.  I belive Iomega needs to be more precise with their spec sheets.

input: This cable works like I expected it.  It came in on time, wrapped perfectly and it works great.  The price was right too!

Revived in good condition.  Looks like quality work.. attached it to an walkie and outside antenna and it worked great.

input: Love it!!

I bought this two years ago for a 10-inch laptop (HP Mini 210), which fits perfectly in it.  There's room in the side pocket for the cord and plug and extra battery, plus anything else relatively small or thin.  I had a 250-page paperback in the main compartment with the laptop without straining the material.

I work in law enforcement.  Our DVD Duplicator broke.  I saw this on Amazon, at a great price.  I bought it for work, as a gift to all my co-workers and myself.  Great for duplicating photo CD's or Security Videos that were used as evidence.

Good news - they work. Quality? What can you expect from this size...
Problem - the packing cover says "Just plug in to your USB port and go!" Also, the seller's website demo video says: " You can use either or both Audio or USB connector". Nevertheless, the speakers work only when BOTH - audio AND USB are connected.
Another problem - the Amazon webpage, which I purchased the speakers from, says "Fee Shipping". At the same time I noticed that I was charged $7.14 for shipping.
I purchased this adapter after reading that it was Mac compatible.  In order to get this hardware working you have to make edits to system files.
I had to work to force the drive into the connector because it is just a little bit misaligned in the box, but once installed it works fine.
Great service from provider. Kept me informed with everything on the MACBOOK.  So far it has been working great.

This product get's very hot during use (hot enough that upon removal from the computer it's hard to hold).  Don't know if that's because the product is defective or if the sdcard is getting that hot but I can't recommend this product as a result.
If you just want to save your lap or legs from the heat of your laptop, this fits the bill perfectly! Lightweight and works
inexpensive but does the job.  Remember you get what you pay for.  I would not recommend if you are doing a lot of cables every day.  Invest in a better set.
target: I would not recommend if you are doing a lot of cables every ...

input: Works great for what it is.  I purchased this as a traveling keyboard for my tablet.  It works good, but needs to be on a solid surface to be usable.  Holds a charge for a long time.  It is a little awkward to use.  If you are typing for more than a few minutes you will want a full, normal keyboard.
Has a weird smell to it.
So far so good, seems to work really well. No issues at all.

I bought this router along with the companion Medialink Wireless N USB Adapter in the hopes of moving from wireless 802.11 g speed up to at least a slow Wireless N speed. The router and adapter did work, but I could never get a better speed than the standard wireless G speed of 54 Mbps--which I was already getting with my old wireless G router.

I called support and was taken back through my setup, which was ok, but the support person had no further suggestions at that point.

I'm returning the router and adapter and buying the Cisco E3200 instead.

Apple's components are have been as cheap as possible in order to provide them with their phones at as little cost to the manufacturer as possible. To date, I've lost 2 Apple cables. One I lost from my cat chewing, another two more from poor manufacturing. Those stopped charging my phone even though it was plugged in and clearly in charging status. The cord is thick, and less prone to nicks, and the car adapter works as it should. Not only that, I can attest to the fact that the adapter even survived after being cycled through the washing machine and dryer. The adapter continued to work without shorting out after being thoroughly dried. I recommend this charger and cable 100%.
target: Better to buy Belkin than Apple

input: Its GRRRRRRRRRRREAT!  This graphics cards runs BF3 and Skryim on Ultra high with no problems. It is much smaller than i thought. It is a great card. Best bang for your bucks.

Fits well, lightweight, net weight with case 1# 9oz., auto on/off very convenient, makes unit easier to hold and view.  Price reasonable compared to OEM  Added Later...  After a longer period of use, two things...  The opening for the audio on/off switch is a little hard to access..  Kind of have to use a fingernail, or maybe if you have a very tiny finger...  Also, the foldable sections of the cover used to tilt the view, or set into viewing position, do not want to stay folded, and tend to spring open..  I have been able to pretty much solve this with a strategically placed piece of stick-on Velcro...

This is right up there with the other name brand cases. I feel much more confident having this case on. My husband has the life proof case for his iPad and besides his being water proof this is just as good. At the time Life Proof wasn't being offered for the air but even now that it is why would you want to spend more then twice as much when this gets the job done?
target: Definitely a competitor with the "name brands"

input: Did exactly what I needed.
Using this on an older Mac Pro running OS X 10.6.8. Set-up was simple and it works like a charm. Much better option than buying and installing an airport card.
What more can I say, this memory is fast and works in my Canon A720 camera

great little device. I read another reviewer use this to mount a difficult usb3 drive to a mac running mavericks and it works. I had a vantec external enclosure that kept unmounting via usb3. So I hooked up the esata cable to this dongle and the drive worked like a charm. Transfer rates on a wd black were 130-140MBps.

I've been wanting to replace my old laptop battery for a long time but was a little low on funds.  These prices are very good, so I ordered one.  It arived on time and works perfectly after I installed and then charger it up.  I would recommend this seller.
Love it makes the I pad less slippery in hand
I wanted this item to reduce the clutter in my storage bins; I usually don't find my flash drives in all this mess.
The cable is well made and feels like it's wrapped in heavy duty rubber.  It makes my computer set up less spaghetti-like by integrating all the main I/O's into one thick cable.  Very good quality.

Definitely feels much better than a regular mouse, but I didn't realize how small it would be. My pinky finger has to splay out because otherwise my hand wouldn't be able to fit on the mouse, and my fingers are too long so I still have to apply a good amount of pressure to the mouse to move it around stably. I wish it came in different sizes or something. Or they should at least warn people that the mouse is for people with hands no longer than like 5 inches or something from your wrist to the tip of your middle finger. But it's better than my other portable mice I have so I guess I will keep it to replace those things while i look for a more ergonomic mouse for my hands.
target: Its alright, kind of small though

input: I waited several months after making this purchase to write the review, because I wanted to make sure I still loved it after using it awhile.  The picture is crystal clear and I have no dead pixels. I would highly recommend this monitor if picture quality is a top consideration.  The only negative thing about this monitor is the built-in speakers are horrible, but I already had external speakers so I just kept them hooked up (I didn't mind this so it didn't affect my review.) If you absolutely need built-in speakers then either look for a different monitor or accept the fact that you'll have sub-par sound.

I've only had the battery for a month, so I don't know what it's lasting power is. But the old battery, before it died, kept the machine going for about an hour, and the new one works for more like 2 - 2 1/2 hours, with my configuration. The minuses:  * it seems to have some difficulty getting to a 100% charge, hovering around 98% most of the time. At one point, it went from 98% to, after an hour of charging, 97%.   * There does not seem to be a way to get the battery to reveal its current state of health.   Still, for $35, keeping my XP computer alive so that I don't have to spend a couple of grand on software updates is not a bad deal.

I thought these would be easier than cutting a standard page to size after printing. They really aren't. I saved about thirty seconds each time I used one of these. That was it. I wouldn't bother unless you really need that thirty seconds. Good luck.

Let me start by stating that I'm a Sysadmin for a medium sized network. In addition to that, I've assembled hundreds of PC's.  I purchased and installed this card without issue.  The unit worked for a little over a week before it began crashing to a black screen.  Once the card was removed and the original configuration was restored, the machine was back up with no issues.  The vendor would not provide an RMA but directed me directly to PNY and so began an email dance back and forth with generic trouble shooting info that didn't apply to the card. After several attempts to get an RMA, and continuing to get more \\"help\\" I finally gave up and threw the card away. Having dealt with many RMA's over the years, I'm amazed how unresponsive this vendor is.  I will never use any PNY product for home or work.
Poor quality. I bought 2 of these cords. From normal use the outside casing became separated from the both ends and the wires inside became exposed.

This Thunderbolt interface rocks. Immediately obvious that it's far faster than USB 3.0. At this point I'm gonna give it 4 stars instead of 5 because I'm having some flaky problems with it on boot. That may turn out to be a mobo issue instead and if it does, I'll come back and adjust this review accordingly.
looks O K, arrived in good shape.  need some help installing it, so not sure how well it will perform

AMAZING! These speakers are so good for what you pay for. If you want to be able to blast music and make it sound rich and have bass this is the best option. With 5,000+ reviews and over 4 stars this is a must! This thing is awesome!

I've had this stylus for about a month and I haven't had any problems with it. It works great for what it is and especially for the price. There are other designs out there without the rubbery tip...but they're more expensive, as well. I opted for the cheaper option and I haven't been disappointed with it. I use it to draw on my HTC Rezound with no problem. It's hard to write small text without a point...but it works great for drawing.
target: Works fine for a capacitive stylus

input: works great in a galaxy S4

This is just some of what the future holds.  I absolutely love the touchscreen on my Gateway AIO.  The computer itself is fast and Windows 7 is awesome (thanks MS).  By far my favorite feature is the touchscreen.  I am constantly using it.  It's great for all sorts of things like resizing documents, reorienting and resizing photos, and just general web browsing.  It's just awesome.  Totally reminds me of Minority Report (not quite that far but with Kinect it just might surpass it  ... no gloves needed).  I highly, highly recommend this machine.    No having a bunch of wires hanging from my machine is great and it just looks beautiful on my desk.  Not quite Apple beautiful but pretty damn nice nonetheless.  Plus, it's Windows, which I prefer and supports pretty much everything.  And if you haven't used Windows 7 yet get ready to fall in love all over again.
target: LOVE the Gateway AIO with Touchscreen

I agonized over getting a Kindle for a long time, not being sure that I could really enjoy reading a book this way.  Shortly after I started reading my first book I was so engrossed that I actually tried to turn the page as if it were a book!  I LOVE it!  Lightweight, easy to hold, easy to read, easy to download books.  I highly recommend it. Get the leather cover to protect it when it's just laying around.  It's very easy to remove the Kindle from the cover for whichever way you want to read.
It's wear out very fast and a plastic corners break after a month.
It was easy to put on my galaxy tab 2, it is sort of non glare, makes looking at the screen a long time easier on your eyes.
I bought two of these for a dual monitor setup.  Both worked excellent out of the box.  Crystal clear.  Big monitor at a great price.

This is a great case for Kindle Fire. I had a more expensive plastic type case that had an elastic band to stay closed and it was horrible. This case is exactly as described and is a lovely shade of purple. It had a slight new smell for a couple days but was truly of no concern. The flip stand is pretty useless...it really cannot stand up at all but I am giving it five stars anyways because I really do like it! Also it fits perfectly and does not cover the speakers at all as someone else claimed. It is easy to put on and take off and stays closed fine. I would definitely buy again.

I really love this accessory pack. It came with everything you needed to add a super super low price. I think the best thing about it was it came in like 2 days. My samsung galaxy note didn't have to be naked long within the 2 days I was able to dress it coverage and use all of the accessories that were provided it's a must-have.

My reason for purchasing the unit was primarily based on price, but also on reviews of it. My confidence in it and the products offered by Corsair, however, has been shaken. I'll spend a bit more for something that will be more reliable for me.

Please note that the one star is not a testament to the actual functioning quality of the PSU, but more of the initial experience.
OEM and a dream.
Installation went smoothly. Occasionally the keys seem to lag or not register sometimes. For the price I would still consider it worth it. 4 Stars

input: I like the color and the function.  Over-all quality is not excellent but i guess that maker could have done better.

It seems like some or all of the ports just quit working periodically.  Therefore, there is inconsistent performance.  I don't understand why this would be.  For instance, my keyboard was plugged into the hub and quit working.  I plugged it into the computer directly and it worked.

Exact fit, no dead pixels, netbook looks/works as well new. The only issue was with packaging. The item was delivered with a USPS sticker noting the package was received at the local post office in damaged condition. It was shipped in a USPS box with a single layer of bubble wrap on each side of the screen. Luckily the item was not damaged and worked perfectly.
Perfect fitting, a straight up replacement for the acer aspire one netbook. Would recommend it for sure if someone needed a keyboard replacement.
works well !

This was the perfect price and length for what I needed it for.  Couldn't find any deals better, and this works perfect.
Nice visor protection

It came yesterday. I opened the package, and found some plastic bits in the bottom of the bubble wrap. \\"what's this then?\\" I ask. I take the 2 minutes to put it together, and immediately found the problem. The corners that hold the ipad in place are made of tiny feeble plastic tabs. about 80% of them were broken off. \\"maybe they don't matter.\\" I put the stand on the desk. It has an uneasy lean about it. I give the 'sturdy metal arm' a wiggle, it sways from side to side on the tiny screw that holds the arm to the base. What a piece of garbage. Returned immediately.

Purchased one of these enclosures in order to be able to recover files from a dead laptop drive. The build quality is very good, I have purchased similar enclosures for more than 2x the cost in the past, which were flimsy plastic and of poor quality. This enclosure is aluminum and all elements of it are of good quality. Does the job very well. Tremendous value.
This product is a must have for Kindle Fire users makes negotiating the screen much more precise.   My fingers just seem to do the work near as accurately. No downside.

This keyboard is extremely solidly built in good quality although a bit heavy. It comes with SD plug for data transfer and prolong the battery for the pad too. It could be thinner & lighter though. This is unique as no other ipad or tablets can transform like the Asus Eee pad.  It's well worth the $118 that I paid.
target: A perfect transformer from touch pad to netbook!

input:
I've tested this product in multiple harsh environments and it has successfully gained my seal of approval.

1) Drop test from 5 feet.
2) Toilet water dunk test then dried in rice.
3) Multiple strike test with fist.
4) Violent shake test while data was being read/written.
5) Extreme heat test in sunny window (115 degrees for 2 hours)
6) Freezer test (0 degrees for 2 hours)

I have a little money to burn and so I can check to see if these devices really and truly can last. This drive is still kicking strong as the day I got it. The case isn't so pretty anymore, but that's purely cosmetic. This is a durable hard drive. I can't wait to try the solid state drives and see if they hold up just as well.
it does everything I want it to

works good. shipped fast. i did notice the charger gets really hot if you leave it plugged in awhile. after observing it i started to unplug it out of the wall and laptop once its fully charged and i plug it in where there are no other cords plugged in and i keep it in a cool place so it doesn't over heat or damage my laptop. so far that's been working and my charger hasn't been getting too hot.

Works just as advertised. Flawless.

input: Sorry but I do not like this cover.  First the power key is not easy to find, because the cover is not cut to reveal the whole power key. second, It only gives you one height horizonally and vertically.  The front of the cover, hides some of the screen, especially if you are playing games such as word with friends.  I made a mistake in buying this cover.  I am seriously thinking about returning it and getting a more expensive cover that can adjust in at least two heights both vertically and horizonally.  I cannot recommend this kindle fire hd cover.
target: Should have paid more for a decent cover.

input: It's absolutely adorable and my computer did recognize it as a drive, but my laptop wouldn't save data to it - which is the whole purpose of having a flash drive. I was able to use MS Dos command prompt to format the drive so that my computer would save data to it, but it would have been nicer if I hadn't had to mess around with it first!

We bought 5 of these for each of our daughters, all different colors.  they fit great and my girls all feel like the case makes thier kindle fires look more classy and special.  Great case for a great price!

input: The case/keyboard works very well for the price.  I have not had any problems with using it.
Excelente and convinient

I ordered this cord for my Toshiba laptop when my last cord broke after a suitcase was thrown on top of it :/. The cord came a few days later and everything was packaged neatly and worked properly. Couldn't ask for anything better.
Pretty cheaply made but does work just be careful with it, mine broke in under a month
Works perfectly for the 2014 version of the tablet. There is a newer tablet with narrow edges that I think would not fit very well.

This is the best router out there!!!  I was told about this name brand by my cable man.  I'd tell you to go ahead and get it, don't let the low price fool you.  Easy to set up and I haven't had any issues.
target: Don't let the low price fool you.

input:
I've been using Logitech products for years, they're normally quite reliable and have good functionality. I bought this mouse to work with my corporate laptop which travels with me daily and I spend at least 7+ hrs with the mouse per day so I'm a pretty intensive user. The precision and buttons are good on this mouse, especially for its size and price. The battery life is also great. A AA battery lasts me 3-6 months, no complaints there!
My issue is that the receiver went bad on my previous M305 so I bought this one as a replacement. When the new mouse is $20 and the receiver is $10 plus $5 shipping....you end up just buying another whole mouse when it dies. Mine was plugged into my laptop and stayed in there for several months with no issue....then all of a sudden it needed to be wiggled to work. It progressively got worse and worse until it didn't work anymore. The issue was not the USB on the laptop but rather the contacts within the little receiver. I can see if I plugged this in daily that the contacts may wear out, but not staying in one place.

Works as advertised, nice to have the mini-usb port open and still be able to to charge using this port.  It snaps on really well and holds very well.  I am not sure if it charges as fast as claimed but it does charge at least as quickly as the other plug in that came with the nexus.

First bought the Fire, wanted online access, but then could not read at the beach.
The Kindle paperwhite would be 5 stars if I could access internet and play games..

This item was hard to use, no instructions were included and no matter how hard you tried, bubbles continued to remain. Finally gave up and said the hell with it.  A waste of my money...to the tune of about 15 bucks, only to find another product WAY cheaper. Bummed that I got burned on the price.  My fault though.
Is ready when I need backup. Longer life than I expected. would recommended this to anyone that goes where access to power is limited.
I really love it.  I can not believe how much the lighted background helps.  I read almost anywhere, if I can, an now I really can - thanks for doing this, it is just great !
I wanted something to surf the web with, or quickly look up the movie schedule. This is a perfect size and it's a great laptop for the price. I would get another one in heartbeat.
target: This is a perfect size and it's a great laptop for the price

input:
I have had the Eco-View since about when the ipad launched. The case looks and feels wonderful. Unfortunately, it starts to fall apart very fast, it loosens up in the top latch that holds the ipad in if for whatever reason you decided to hold it upside down it will fall out.

The leather is trimmed with a plastic lining that after time begins to separate, so I just cut the lining with a scissor where ever it separates.

This case is not intended to offer much protection should the ipad fall to the ground as there are slightly exposed corners. In fairness I do use my ipad every single day so it does get alot use, however I expected the case to last much longer than a couple of months before falling apart.
target: You will love it AT FIRST, then it starts to fall apart very fast.

input: I bought the Paperwhite for my 64-year-old mother, who has never used a Kindle before.  I thought the touchscreen would really help her break into the e-reader world.  She needed a little help navigating the device at first, but now she exclaims how much she loves it just about every time I call.  With the built-in light, it is easy for her to see and operate; connecting her debit card to her Amazon account has made it especially simple for her to purchase the books she wants; and she is so happy with the fact that she doesn't have a pile of books building up on her shelf anymore. It's probably the best gift I've ever bought her.
Perfect, inexpensive replacement for the original...which our new puppy chewed through!  It is exactly like the one that came with the MacBook.

Yes, it has a retractable USB connector. Nice. For me, however, the force required to insert into the extension cord is enough to cause the connector to retract. I need to hold it open with my thumb while I insert the drive.

The cap on my other USB flash drive is definitely a loss item, but I haven't lost it yet...

The drive itself performs as advertised. I haven't run any serious tests for speed, but it transfers about 950 MB in a couple of minutes. The LED activity light is very bright compared to the one on my other drive. The Memorex drive lacks a physical write-protect switch.

The item was defective. I installed the card and there was no video and the computer didn't boot. After removing the card the computer booted normally. The same behavior was observed on another computer as well. It costed me $8 to ship it back. The seller's policy stated that if they test the card and find the card defective they would send me replacement. They opted to make refund, so probably will try to sell it again to somebody else.

great bag, use it for my 13.3 dvd player

I bought it for my son - he loves it. Very sturdy and nice looking as well easy to use when gaming. Thanks!

Purchased this to replace the battery on my laptop that was no longer holding a charge & caused me to only be able to use my laptop when plugged in.  It was exactly what I needed to solve the problem.
Fan are just about totally silent and draw very few amps.

Make sure you purchase SATA data cable to connect an SSD drive you may have just bought, unless of course there are spares just dangling inside you computer. No cables come with the Samsung SSD drive I bought. This cable fit nicely, though a bit loose, does not lock but fits the ports snugly.

This is best case I've had yet for the Nexus 10. It clips on easily with no fuss, has a stiff 3 x part lid that protects the screen, yet easily folds into a triangle profile to stand the tablet up.

Lightweight, strong and cheap, the perfect combination.
after purchasing many covers for my kindles I stumbled across this one, only way I would replace it is if it wore out love it, love it, love it

input: This little NAS has exceeded all my expectations.  I highly recommend this NAS over most of the competition.  Setup was a breeze and it has solved all my problems connecting various systems to my data.

My main reason for updating my router/modem combo? I was never able to get Nat Type 2 connection on my PS3 with my old router even with port forwarding software. Plugged this Netgear N600 in and no more problems. Painless installation and setup. The only problem I had was I forgot to change my IP address back to dynamic, my old router/modem was set up for static IP just to get some basic functions of my PS3 to work. A quick check in the "troubleshooting" section of the manual said to make sure your IP was dynamic, it also said it would be uncommon if it wasn't. I guess I'm uncommon. Im very happy with the product!

Worked great, did the job it was bought for.
The soft rubber on the top of the headset degraded and fell apart after 4 years.
target: Worked great, did the job it was bought for

input: The ipad itself works great, like new, however it did not arrive in original box as stated, nor did it come with original charger as stated.  The charger no longer works.  I could've purchased an "open item" at best buy and gotten those things for a little more without having to buy a new charger.
Not a standout, but the price is right and they are reliable.
Easy to connect, fast.

I purchased this drive to keep a backup of my Aperture library while I am on scuba vacations. I would hate to lose my MacBook Pro AND all my photos from the trip so this is extra insurance to have a copy of everything. The drive is fairly compact however there are some portable drives out there that are smaller if you need something really compact. Included is a nice rubber cover that will protect the drive from drops but it does take away some of the portability factor. There are three included cables so you won't need anything extra to get going.
I plugged the drive in via the Firewire 800 and waited for it to mount. It took about 15 seconds to mount and then was ready to go. It is bus powered so it does not require any separate power supply, just plug into your computer and let the drive mount to use. I began copying some files to test the drive. It was very fast and worked just as promised, preformatted for the Mac and ready to go. I will report back on speed and longer term performance as I use the drive more but so far it is a worthy purchase.
Works great, but the little rubber feet on the bottom have all fallen off in less than six months. Now my Macbook slides around on the desk...
target: Works Great, But Rubber Feet Fell Off

input: I purchased the Almond as a range extender / repeater and it was extremely easy to set up.  The onscreen menu was very straight forward and took less than 5 minutes.  I didn't have to get into my computer at all during the installation.  Highly recommended as a range extender.  I cannot comment on the set up as a router, but would anticipate it's equally as easy.
target: Using it as WiFi repeater - Very easy to set up!

input: The device did not fit well and the case did not feel solid when closed.

First, I want to thank Amazon.com for providing a web site that allowed me to review what others said about this router, and others, before I made my purchase. This info is invaluable.

I just installed this router today to replace a D-Link WBR-2310 on my home network. We have two computers using Ethernet connections to the router, a wireless notebook PC, and the Xbox 360 which is connected via an Ethernet cable. With the WBR-2310, despite hours of screwing around with the configuration, the Xbox live connection would disconnect frequently; so, most of the time we had it connected directly to the modem, thus preventing simultaneous use of the internet on our PC's.

The DGL-4300 was a dream (comparatively) to install. I couldn't believe that it sniffed out the Xbox and the other computers automatically. I didn't have to do a thing on the Xbox. And, we have been able to play the Xbox live and use the internet on our PCs all day without any problem.
target: Get this one for Xbox 360 Live

I ordered the Apple Wireless Mighty Mouse from this seller because it listed it as having an instruction book, and I really NEED that! The Mouse arrived promptly, but no instructions. When I contacted the seller, they got right back to me the same day with a link to the Apple website. Unfortunately for me, that one was for troubleshooting. I contacted my MAC guru, and he gave me this link: [...] and told me to look for the \\"big button that says MANUALS\\" - hint: it doesn't stand out on the page, I had to kind of hunt before I saw it. I still had a little trouble, because it was not a new installation, so the setup assistant didn't pop up. I opened \\"system applications\\" then \\"Mouse\\" and at the bottom of that dialog box there is a blue button for Bluetooth set up and that worked. The mouse is much more responsive than my old wired one, so here's hoping it's the end of the problems. I would definitely buy from the seller again in the future.
target: Off to a rocky start, but came right in the end

Want to increase the memory for your iPhone, iPod or iPad, then consider this device. Its wireless and works just like and external storage drive. Although figuring out how to use it is slightly quirky and not very well defined. Once you get past that point it becomes a very useful device especially since it supports both SD memory cards and USB drives. Its therefore very simple with this device to take a 16 gig Apple device and make its storage only limited to the how many and what size your SD memory and or USB drives are. battery life is several hours but you can always plug it into a usb charger or port to recharge the internal batteries.

I was considering a wireless hard drive but this device seems to provide more flexibility than using a single hard drive, especially when moving back and forth between portable devices.
target: A necessary device for iPhone or iPad or iPod

input:
There are a lot of screen protectors out there. The main reason that I chose this one was its blue light UV filter, as I know that that precise light wave (around 450-470 nM) is damaging for the eyes.
I'm also glad that I haven't received a flimsy screen protector. This one is robust, yet touching my screen is just as responsive as it was before I put iLLumiShield on it.
I had a little trouble, though, to separate the protecting layer from iLLumiShield itself. The small tag which was supposed to help removing that layer was of very little help. I had to separate the layer from the Screen protector using my nail, but then applying the Shield on the screen went well.
But don't let this last comment turning you away from this screen protector. The 5 stars I gave is a clear recommendation for buying it.
