This was my experience. I bought a NEW product from a seller. When I received it and opened it, I found there's no Setup Wizard CD inside and no factory sealed labels on product. At that moment, I knew this is a used one but I paid by NEW price. After I checked with Cisco's engineers and they proved the one I received is not a NEW product from their database record. Of course, I filed a claim to A-to-Z team and returned it. Then I paid attention on seller's description for this router, I focused on NEW, FACTORY SEALED LABEL, etc. After I re-ordered a new one and followed installation CD steps, it works with my home's network without calling Cisco's tech support.
target: Watch seller's description on this product

input: I just love this case. I like the slim case it makes the tablet feel lighter. The fold does not get in the way of the speakers and I can hear my music well without the ear buds. I like the band that holds the fold into place it keeps the front well protected.

I attempted to use this for work with an HP Elitebook laptop running windows 8 and I am very unhappy. I'm chucking these in the trash as I waited a bit too long to return them. There are a few issues:

Once paired, the blue tooth connection would often fail to reconnect. The device would need to be removed using the windows blue tooth control panel and then paired again. It made me late for several calls.

The blue tooth audio connection was very poor and "popped and cracked." It was difficult for me to participate in conversations and music was un-listenable.

After a few weeks, the small boom microphone would not stay in place. It freely swung around and could not be manually positioned.

These headphones have generally good reviews so I'm surprised with my experience. Perhaps the manufacturer has released a new poorly conceived model recently.

Even though the cord is extremely short, we gave it a try.
It worked about a week, then stopped working.
Waste of money....

I had to return this to the local Apple store after a year of use as the cord cracked near it's entrance to the brick. They did give me a new one without charge and said that this has happened a lot. If you travel a lot do not wind it around the wings that fold out as you will wear out the cord at the insertion.

input: it's a motherboard issue. 3 out of 4 usb port at the back went bad so I had to use an extension port. the front usb port died few months after. called support and that's what they've told me..motherboard is dying. few months of struggle..the entire unit crashed and wasn't able to make it again. I love this little device.  Yesterday, I was waiting in an ungodly long line at the post office and luckily had my library at my fingertips. I was able to check my email as well as read some articles using google reader in the middle of the post office.  If you like to read, then this is the e-reader you should get.  Use it for books, and think of the internet as just a perk.

My battery only lasted 6 months and then no longer held it's charge.  I'm lucky if I get 20 minutes now after a full charge.    I ordered this battery from a different supplier (New Energy Warehouse).   It was sent from China and not the USA (as stated).  The battery had no serial number or barcode.   There wasn't even a full invoice or guarantee card.    I recommend to send back any battery which comes without a serial number and full invoice.  Simply claim through Amazon within 90 days of ordering if you can get no answer from the seller.
target: Make sure you get a battery with a serial number and full invoice

I've had version 2 of this router for two years now, and it worked almost flawlessly(Could not get it to act as a VPN Server - VPN Client was fine).  I recently switched my ISP from DSL to Cable Modem, and the router would start crashing about once a day.  After about two hours of research, I determined that the latest version of the firmware at the time(1.45.7) was contributing to the problem.  Downgrading the firmware fixed it and I have had no problems since.  This thing is a rock, but be careful about upgrading the firmware, as it might cause problems like this.  Looks like they've just released a new one for versions 1 and 2...

Also, I love the soft plastic material, which has a matte finish to it, which keeps it from being slippery, and the clear color is awesome. Also, it is very compatible with the smart pad cover, which I am using with it.

Usually I do not write reviews. However, I think in this case it’s good to share with you guys. After five days of testing, I decided to return this product. I do not recommend this product because of the following:
- As soon as you receive the device, you discover that you need to format your external drive, i.e., you need to make a backup or will lose everything.
- Although the installation is easy, I was not able to upload my files using my notebook (remote access), just using the IOS app.
- In my local network, it was too slow to move the files. In addition, I had "tons" of errors during this process.
- In only 5 days, this device killed my external drive; I've lost a 3Tb hard disk.
target: This device killed my external drive in 5 days!!!

Pros:  - Good concept    Cons:  - Weak signal strength  - Battery Life is only about 2 hours; likely long enough for continuous remote use.  - They don't distinguish between two very different devices (the 3G and 4G).  It's the luck of the draw which one you get because they are both called \\"PHS300\\". If you get the one pictured here with the logo on the unit, you have the older 3G version.  If you get the unit without the logo, you have the newer 4G version.    My first unit (a Version 2 4G unit) died within 2 days.  RMA'd it and the 2nd unit I received was a Version 1 unit.  Cradlepoint swapped the Version 1 for a Version 2 at no cost.  I was at first frustrated by Cradlepoint customer service.  However, in the end they did come thru and I changed my rating accordingly.  Thanks Mike at Cradlepoint; good customer service.
target: Frustrated at first but Cradlepoint Customer Serive Came Thru

Whatever eReader you decide on, consider there are two minimum qualifications: a large catalog and eInk. The first is obvious. Why buy an eReader without easy access to any book that you can pick up at a large book retailer? The second must not be discounted. If you purchase an eReader with a backlight, your eyes will tire after a chapter or two and I fear will have hazardous effects for heavy readers.

The reason I give the Kindle 5 stars is that it is one of two eReaders (including eReader software) that meets this criterion. Naysayers will rightly so complain about wiz-bang design issues in the Kindle. But, unless a device meets these two qualifications, it is not an eReader.

It comes with high res screen and is anti-glare. It also comes with the free upgrade to OSX LION through the apple site. This product is a real winner, and I'm writing this review to share the wealth.   I would suggest that you buy this laptop from NETCOMPUSA. They not only sold this item to me for under $2,100. After I updated my Late 2008 Macbook to Yosemite, it was so slow I could barely use it anymore.  The wheel of death would pop up for minutes at a time whenever I opened a program or really any time I tried to do anything.  God forbid I tried to multi-task.  I thought before I bought a new Macbook, that I would try adding more memory to this one just to see.  Well, I'm so glad I did.  It's as fast as it ever was before now.  Maybe even faster.  I tested it by opening every program in my dock, and it barely blinked an eye (or twirled the wheel at all), and switching among the programs is no problem at all.  I'm so happy to have saved $1,000+ by getting this memory instead of a new computer.  I DID have to reset my SMC after I installed it because of some loud noises the fan started making, but that was no big deal (Google this if you hear weird noises after installation), and since then it's been working great!
target: Restored Life to My Late 2008 Macbook!

I bought this for my bungalow.  The bungalow has aluminum siding and foiled back insulation, so it is hard for me to get a signal outside, and did not want to switch WIFI inside and outside.  This led me to look for an access point solution.  These are affordable and do the job well.  It looks good on the hallway ceiling, and not cluttered with cords due to being powered by POE.  With only the access point in the hallway, I can get WIFI in my garage, and after adding the garage can get really good signal on the property.  It was easy the configure using the Unified software, and the access controller does not need to be running continuously.  Just needs to be up to configure.  I highly recommend this product as an easy N solution for small business, or large area, or non-signal friendly area.  (If Amazon did not tell you there is a newer version of this for AC ~$250)

I got this little gem going on my Debian system with ease by the following steps:    1) # apt-get install nvidia-detect  2) # nvidia-detect  This utility will come back with a recommendation to install the appropriate driver.  In this case it is the nvidia-glx package.  3) # apt-get install nvidia-glx  This will install the driver along with a  number of dependencies.  4) # mkdir /etc/X11/xorg.conf.d  5) # echo -e 'Section \"Device\"
	Identifier \"My GPU\"
	Driver \"nvidia\"
EndSection' > /etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/20-nvidia.conf  6) # reboot  After rebooting run the NvIdia Settings utility to verify that everything is as it should be.  Under the section PowerMizer I set my system to Prefer Maximum Performance.

Although another reviewer suggested "throw away the manual", I wasted 10 minutes trying to set up the Print Server without it. But after I followed the directions in the manual, I had it set up in another 10 minutes, and it's worked perfectly from several different PC's (Win2000 and WinXP) since then.
It took me about 5 minutes to set up from a Mac (OS9.2) using the Appletalk window - it saw the Printer right away.
I agree the DHCP can't work with the PC setup - you have to enter an IP address to set up the printer at each PC, and if you used DHCP you would be constantly changing the IP address. Perhaps there is another way to identify the Print Server besides IP address, but I don't know what that would be.
It's a great Print Server, and the old print server PC is now a boat anchor under my desk. I haven't tried the USB port, so no comment on that.

I bought this little bluetooth and added it to my Dell D620 laptop.  That was fairly easy.  The difficult part was finding the correct driver for my laptop.  I finally found one that worked on the Toshiba website.  I downloaded a zip file called BT-stack-toshiba, within the zip is a file called v80012T_20110809_x32.  This is the only driver I could find that would work with my Dell D620 Windows 7 Ultimate 32 bit version. A few other drivers would install and my mouse might work for a few seconds but this is the only driver that actually worked. I did get an error installing this driver but then it loaded ok afterward.

This device is an absolute blessing as I was able to set it up within minutes and get my files backed up with no problems. For the value, it's hard to beat the ReadyNAS products. I was able to set this device up in my basement near my router and do not plan on ever needing to touch it because it seems to be well-built.

First, though it appears to be black with dark grey legs -- both in the Amazon picture and on the box it arrives in -- it's actually a medium grey platform with light grey legs. So if you need it to be a particular color to blend with your desk and monitors, just be aware that there is a bit of false advertising going on here.

Second, the adjustable leg pieces are just too big -- about 1.5 inches each -- so it's very difficult to get exactly the right height. It would be better if they were smaller (say .75 inches), so that you could get the platform to sit at the height you really need.

All that said, I haven't seen any better options on Amazon, so I might just stick with it.

This is the perfect keyboard for anybody who prefers to do their computing in a dark cave. After messing around with various lighting schemes for my desk, I just couldn't find the right balance.  What I really wanted was a back lighted keyboard like I have grown accustomed to on the [[ASIN:B007473X6A Apple MacBook Pro]].  This keyboard is exactly what I was looking for.  The lighting is gentle on the eyes and I am no longer struggling to find those seldom used keys on the fringes of the keyboard.  I chose this keyboard over the back lighted gaming keyboard because I wanted a quieter keyboard with less key travel with a feel similar to what I have on the laptop.  Again, this keyboard did not disappoint. For many years I have been using the Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000. I highly recommend this keyboard.

input: Not much else to compare to since this is the only protector I have used for my ipad2, but works great . One note is that even after using the plastic tool to squeeze out the excess air bubbles, may have very small ones initially there, but these appear to disappear after a few days.  Protects well.  I buy the full body shield, don't apply the back and cut it to use to protect the screen of another ipad (does not fit exactly but gets the job done).  After 1 year, had only 1 scratch on it (not sure how it happened, blame my family member who was using it), though I do use a magnetic flip cover as well.  Does not smear much and easy to clean with slightly damp cloth.

We bought a number of these for our school personnel - not from Amazon, but from another large IT vendor.  Machine is as advertised except for monitor.  The monitor requires positioning (about 110 degrees) with very little quality flexibility. Picture the subtle spreadsheet lines you see when working in Excel or Google Drive Spreadsheet.  When the angle is slightly off - you cannot see them.  Other people are working with are finding the same thing.  At first I thought it was a contrast control, but it does not exist.  Even when the angle is good, the monitor's quality is below par.  I think you will find yourself getting frustrated.  We regret buying them.

The adjacent bedroom has a cable connection / cable digital box.  I am able to watch the cable TV in the bedroom with the box thanks to the pass through HDMI connection on the IOGEAR transmitter.  I am also able to watch cable TV in the 2nd bedroom too with the IOGEAR receiver.  The quality of the video and audio is GREAT.  I am 100% satisfied with the IOGEAR wireless digital kit.  The distance between the transmitter and receiver is about 30 feet with one wall (drywall and wood studs) in between.  I highly recommend this product.

They measure a scosche under 2" BTW so they will wobble in your hole. Good thing they come in a four pack because the first one broke on installation. And by installation I mean setting the grommet in the hole!

Please, dear friends, I implore you! Spend the extra $1.25 on quality-made grommets so you don't have to spend your life in shame as I do. These grommets will be my scarlet letter for all time.

I needed an internet connection in my workshop which is 300 feet from my house.  I had no signal at the shop from my Cisco wireless n router from the house.  I set up the system using a Linksys access point feeding signal from the router to the Hawking antenna on the house.  The shop has identical antenna and Linksys access point.  This gave very low signal strength and speed.  I found EnGenius Network Device EUB9603H USB Adapter 150Mbps 600mW 802.11b/g/n.  This gave the shop computer both excellent signal strength and speed to allow normal surfing and access to network files.  I am quite satisfied with the quality of the setup at a very reasonable price for this system setup.
target: Good system, but signal booster needed for signal strength

I've had a Kindle Touch for years, and love it.  I read a lot.  I'm older, and have noticed more eyestrain after reading for extended periods of time.  I'd been considering a Paperwhite for a year, and finally decided to bite the bullet and purchase 2, one for each of us.  We've had them for about a month, and WOW--what a difference!  The ability to adjust the brightness of the screen is great--it's not backlit, like a tablet (I don't enjoy reading on a tablet because of that).  The Paperwhite is light, too...lighter than the Touch, and far lighter than the Fire HD.  I purchased Finte covers (less expensive than the suggested Amazon case...We love Amazon for so many reasons, but their cases are too pricey for what they are)...the Finte cases are attractive, inexpensive and are easy to deal with, and has the "wake up your Kindle when you open it" feature.  LOVE the Paperwhite...if you're an avid reader, you will appreciate this reader!

This piece works exactly as described.  Two 4-pin connectors connect in to create one 6-pin connector.  The cables were long enough to reach from my power supply to the back of the video card.  It was nice not having to purchase a new power supply!  As some of the other reviews said, the connection ends are a little cheap-ish.  I was actually able to push the 6-pin end into the back of my video card UPSIDE DOWN! The pins were shaped correctly, but I was still able to push them in, likely due to the cheapness of the plastic.  Luckily I stopped before I powered up the unit and inserted it the correct way.  Just don't do what I did...look closely and make sure the pins are going in the right direction.  But once again, I have had no issues running my new video card.  Steam games are FULL STEAM AHEAD!

While I have no problem with this being available to adults, I was concerned that it is just a click away for a young child to stumble upon.  They are listed with all other books that are free to prime members.  Perhaps a separate section or some parental lockouts might be helpful?  I am now unable to allow my independent nine year old to search for his own books.  I know some parents are planning to buy these specifically for children, and they should be aware that this inappropriate content is easily accessible.  Very disappointing.

I like the look and feel of this product and unlike some customer and editorial reviews, I actually prefer the arrangement of the side buttons.  The macro button is far removed as it should be and the vertical arrangement of the two programmables are just right for me.  Very easy to select and much bettor than the usual horizontal configuration.    It has good to excellent battery life and I like the combo 'mouse feet' storage, charger and cord storage module.  It's not only utilitarian but....cool.    With my large hands I would actually like more height built in to the body of the mouse but it is large as mice go and has good length.    The wheel is not entirely to my liking.  I would prefer it further to the front and with a smooth movement as opposed the the 'ratcheted' feel it has now.    The button dedicated to opening the games folder in Win 7 really should be programmable.    Microsoft is too often an easy and inviting target but all in all, this effort is a very nice product.
target: Sidewinder X8.  A Good Effort From Microsoft

This memory module did not work with my Dell Inspiron 3147. After a few hours the machine failed and it would no longer start up. When I reported this problem to the vendor, parts-quick, they pointed out that Dell's reference guide (PDF) says only 4GB is supported.

Intel's own documentation says that the Intel Pentium N3830 CPU supports up to 8GB, and several Dell Inspiron 3147 users have reported a successful upgrade to 8GB. I returned the memory to the vendor, and ordered an 8GB upgrade elsewhere.

Go with the cheaper Logitech keyboards.

So I got an External Hard drive- but that wouldn't work because I had to buy a Dell subscription thing in order to sore it on anything other than a usb device. How many people have a 20gb usb device? So by the time I buy the USB device, it already slowed down and seemed to have aged far past it's prime. Moreover random lint gets caught behind the touchscreen. Perhaps this one is defective and needs to be returned. Or they are now about a quarter of the quality that they used to be.

I use Firefox or I.E will not see the setup menu side bar at left hand side. There is only use Android Opera browser can see the side bar menu. The manual connection setup is not function well, too. Voila! I not only got clear sound again, I got much better sound! I'm no audiophile, but I can easily hear things in many songs that I haven't heard before. All that being said, there is no guarantee that this sound card will give you a more pleasant listening experience. I can only tell you about my experience with this card, and my experience has been pretty darn good. If your on-board audio is giving out, consider this.

For about twenty years, all I used were gel pads for my keyboard and mouse. I upgraded to different types throughout the years and never thought I’d change until my last one popped and gel started oozing out. Who knows how long it oozed for before I noticed. All I know is that one day, the keyboard pad felt flatter and I saw this sticky, clear gel all over my desk.

Not only did it take me several hours to remove the gel from the desk, my keyboard was also ruined and had to be thrown out.

Time to try something new. I bought this keyboard pillow pad and it’s been great. It turns out that I like the way the pillow feels better than the gel anyway! It’s comfortable, supportive, and feels very durable. My only wish is that the pad would spread all the way across instead of having two different pads since there’s a gap that I notice all the time. Never going back to gels again!
target: So much better than gel pads

input: First off, this tablet arrived in less than a week even though the estimated delivery time was much longer. This is actually our 2nd Ugee product. We had previously bought a Ugee M708, and were pleasantly surprised at how good it was for the price, having owned a similar, and much more expensive Wacom tablet. We decided to give this a go since the comparable Cintiq is 4x the cost. It is a great tablet. No noticeable lag, nice adjustable stand, comfortable pen, huge screen. We had a slight problem with it syncing up to Adobe Flash, but Ugee customer service helped fix it right away, and everything works perfectly. We could not have been happier with the care we received from them. The customer service is outstanding, some of the best I have ever encountered. I would definitely recommend this product to others. I will update this if we run in to any other issues.

input:
The Blurex Rocket WiFi adapter and antenna is a little over 18 in. long and comes with an offset mounting bracket of painted metal plus screws and cable ties for installation. The permanently-attached cable with a USB 2.0 connector is about 16 ft. long. It can be used indoors or mounted outside.

Drivers for Windows, LInux, and Mac OS X are included on a mini disc. Installation was easy and took only a few minutes.

The antenna has a wide range and provides a definite signal boost to full strength in my own apartment and down the hallway. 802.11n data rate is up to 150 Mbps up & down.

I used this antenna to set up an open guest network as I have benefited from a neighbor's open guest network when having trouble with my own internet.

Blurex provided a Rocket for evaluation and review.
target: Easy to setup, instant WiFi signal boost

\\"My needs are simple, the BEST\\".    My interest in this device was to evaluate its capability for use within a private high school that serves the bottom socio-economic quartile.   Our goal is to increase the quantity and quality of reading done by students in an environment where we cannot afford up to date textbooks and fiction.    The product met or exceeded every technology requirement without exception.   This product received our highest value, ease of use, design, networking, and durability ratings.   Instead of buying books and placing them on shelves, we are purchasing this portable hand held digital library for students to check-out and use.  (We lack the funding to simply give each student their own unit).    Objections to the device: Old style 20th century vintage English Language Arts (ELA) teachers could not overcome the lack of physically turning pages when reading.  Apparently old style paradigms die hard for the veteran teachers.  Students embraced this digital library with energy and full enthusiasm.  (When inflexible Teachers fail to recognize the abilities of students, you can stop wondering why we have education problems in this country).    This product is superior in every way save one: Color.  For graphics, maps, illustrations, etc. the device needs color display capabilities.

Performed fantastically for taking photos on continuous mode. The size is also nice to have although I would recommend buying 2 smaller ones in case something gets corrupted. Always format your card inside your camera!
target: Way faster than my old card!

This is a well made and good looking case.  Much better than the ones you get on eB** for $9.98.  Included in its box is a nice leatherette case, the USB cable, the manual on a mini-CD, and even its own screwdriver.  Installing the disk into the case is simple.  The USB cable has two ends to plug into the computer.  The second one is in case your computer doesn't put out enough power from a single USB outlet to power it.  If that is the case, you plug the second end into a second USB outlet.  On my IBM ThinkPad T60p I only needed the one.    Installing the case and disk on my Vista system was automatic.  You must format the disk before installing on the system.  The case itself is not recognized with an unformatted disk or no disk at all.    Yes, the case shows fingerprints and, as one reviewer suggested, it could use feet to keep it from sliding, but these are minor quibbles.  Overall, it is completely functional and easy to use.  I am very happy with it.

I chose this cable modem for my parents when they moved to suburban area of DC and they have Cox cable for Internet. No connection drop or any other problems since day one. Just needed to let install by Cox installation guy (not an option... had to pay installation fees regardless). They sometimes turned off at nights when no one at home use Internet. They put it on the middle floor of 3-story town house. Wireless connection from 3FL is great... 5 full bars everywhere whereas 1FL (no basement in the house, just GF) can be 3 bars sometimes. That office room is blocked by the stairway and one BR from where the modem is located one floor up. With external wireless adapter hooked up to USB extension cable (I taped that adapter on top of a bookcase) and got full 5 bars. I don't see any reason to get a new modem as long as thy have Cox, only cable service in the area.
target: Still working great after 2+ years of daily use

The only thing I could possibly complain about is that the back button has to be pressed by your thumb, which it seems I usually have to reposition my hand to press. This might be more of a \\"thumb\\" problem rather than a mouse problem. My other mouse's back button is on top of the mouse beside the wheel, which is more convenient for me. Other than that (which is a small problem) I have been VERY satisfied with the performance of this mouse.

I bought these for my two young children, who like to draw and write but not every environment is suitable for pens, pencils, markers, etc.

The children have only had them for a day, but so far they are a great hit. I connected a Sony DSR-45 DVcam videotape deck to my Lenovo T440 PC using this adapter and the laptop image immediately displayed a vertically rolling Venetian blind image superimposed over the normal PC desktop image. Then Windows7 displayed the following warning: \\"Power Surge On Hub Port - A USB device has exceeded the power limits of its hub port...\\". I had purchased two units, so I tested the 2nd copy as a precaution, with the same error.

Knowing that a vertically rolling Venetian blind effect is common to a ground loop between two AC powered video devices, I then tested the same scenario by connecting a Panasonic AG-DVX100B camcorder powered by battery to the Lenovo T440 PC, and got the same error message without the rolling Venetian blind visual image. Sony Vegas Pro video editing software did not recognize the connection to be compliant with IEEE-1394 firewire protocol. I cannot recommend this adapter unless the manufacturer can issue a software upload bug fix.
target: This device failed two bench tests using industry-standard video equipment

I always like to keep my computer screens and keyboards covered when I stop using them each day. I checked into several varieties, and found this one, ready to ship immediately. This has turned out to be an excellent product for me.

For what it is, it works fine.  It feels slightly cheap and flimsy, the screw holes are not well-drilled or aligned properly, and the stand doesn't have a perfectly flat bottom and so has a tendency to rattle a bit, but the drive itself works.  Transfer rates are fine, the external power means that the draw on the USB port isn't an issue, cables are fine and of adequate length.  For a sub-$20 USB drive, that's pretty much all you can expect.    If, after you buy it, it claims to have connected fine but the drive doesn't appear anywhere, you probably need to assign a drive letter by hand.  In Windows, go to the control panel, select \\"Computer Management\\", find \\"Storage\\", and look under \\"Disk management\\" to see if your drive appears there.  Right click and select \\"Change drive letter and paths\\" and give it a unique letter; if it's a new hard drive you might need to format it as well, which you can do from the same spot.

I bought this as a replacement for a corded mouse.  I paid 5X the corded price to get rid of the cord, which was always getting in the way.  I was also interested in the long battery life.    First, the mouse is very picky about what surface it is on.  I finally found a mouse pad that it would track but the mouse to screen scaling is almost 1:1.  As a result, moving the cursor across the screen takes about 5 sweeps of the wrist. Now my wrist hurts. Eventually, I was able to fix the problem by cleaning the LED with a swab and alcohol. I assume that the special low power LED is sensitive to dirt or dust.     I don't recommend this mouse to anyone unless you try it in the store.  Lotsa luck with that, since you have to destroy the packaging to remove it.    Save your money and buy a cheaper and more robust product.

input: I wanted something to protect my paperwhite from dust, scratches, and minor bumps.  But I wanted something as minimal as possible that could be removed completely when using the device.  This cover fit the requirements perfectly.  It is easy to put the device inside the cover and remove it, but fits well enough that I don't feel like it will fall out easily.  While covered, it protects well from minor dirt, splashes, bumps, and scrapes.  It also adds very minimal size or bulk.  I don't suspect it would protect it from a drop well, but that wasn't important to me.  Unlike other covers and cases, when removed, there's nothing left on the device meaning no additional bulk or weight while using it.  This is the perfect cover for someone that wants their Kindle protected when they aren't using it and don't want any gear attached to it when they are reading.

I've encountered no interference issues and the range of the 5 GHZ band is sufficient to watch HD video in my living room about 75 feet from the router without glitches or stuttering. Considering the introductory price of $149, I feel that it provides good value and terrific features. However, this is not a router for the neophyte or PC challenged! Overall, highly recommended.

Don't be duped by the hype about expensive HDMI cables.  Nobody should spend more than this on an HDMI cable.  Search for CNET's "Why all HDMI cables are the same" articles.  Don't believe them?  Check Consumer Reports.  Any well-made High Speed (C2) HDMI cable will carry 1080p, 3D, 4K -- why do you think you need this? -- video (60Hz, 120Hz, 240Hz TV doesn't matter) and digital audio.  The HDMI TMDS standard uses two sets of wires to transmit the signal, one out of phase with the other.  The receiver inverts one set and combines it with the other, thereby cancelling any in-phase noise that is picked up along the cable, just as balanced audio cable does.  If you need extremely long cable, you may need heavier gauge cable.  If you move your components around frequently, you may want a more limp cable and you'll have to pay for it.  For the usual 6-10ft cable and components that stay put, spend your money on better components or more movies.
target: Well-made, durable cable does the job

I was amazed that this adapter/charger was such a great buy and is identical to my original adapter/charger.  You can't beat this price.  Acer wanted to charge me so much more.  Great find! I bought several and saved a bundle.

Just got my new Kindle Paperwhite, to replace my old keyboard Kindle. I really love it, it's just simple and perfect! Great customer service also in replacing my old one, which I could send back, so I don't end up with another thing cluttering my cupboard. Thanks, Amazon!

Got the leather version of this product for Christmas and am very happy with it.  The Ipad mini fits perfectly, the camera lines up with the camera hole, the latch fits securely enough that I haven't bothered to use the elastic strap and the auto on/off feature works great.  The case adds almost nothing to the height or width of the iPad mini and is light enough that the final weight of the iPad and the case is only around 1 pound. I was going to just use the case when I was outside the house but it feels so natural that I just leave it in the case all the time.  I got the leather version because the biggest complaint about the faux leather case had been premature wear.  So far the leather product shows no sign of wear at all and hopefully that will continue.  Would definitely recommend this case.
I loved it. We arrived very quickly and all functional.
Yes, what is written above is absolutely correct as of today 5/5/13  Sometimes Amazon doesn't win them all.  Well built product made out of steel

I use this for my Thinkpad W530. I didn't realize how much I needed a replacement 9-cell battery until I started using it. It's something about being able to use it for 8 hours at a time and not having to worry about charging that makes me excited.

The Reflex Lab Huge Gaming Mouse Pad definitely lives up to its name. It's so massive, my kids took it sledding last week.
Not really, but it is awesome. Especially for hard core gamers such as myself.

This case is not good quality.  It looks inexpensive (didn't online) and has lost its ability to hold up my screen (the notches are not defined enough to keep the Kindle from sliding out..)  I will have to get another...
Food and coffee were spilled on the keyboard, surounding case and even between the battery and the battery compartment. I ran Avast anti virus immediately and it found five critical viruses.

input: I tried another one that had slightly better reviews, but after waiting for it to come from China, I could not make it work with my Mac.  So, I was relieved that this one did the trick.  Just open Photo Booth and switch the camera source.  I haven't had a chance to use it for actual work yet, but it seems as if the quality will be good enough to get the job done.

This product arrived within the time frame for shipping without incident.  When I turned my computer on I was amazed at how quiet it was, I wasn't sure it was actually on..haha.  This unit is working great and I had no issues installing it and connecting all the peripherals.  This was a great buy.

This thing is awesome!!! It has word processing capability as well as movies, music, books, magazines, and newspapers.  I can email a resume that's saved on the Kindle, play Scrabble, or buy new books.  Plus the picture is sloop clear! And the books agree backlit so that I can read at night without a book light.  I don't have a single complaint!!! It's been worth every penny already!
target: An awesome purchase!!! Highly recommend it!

input: Memory card failed after 2 weeks on a long trip.  I would receive random messages of reformat card and reinsert memory card.  In addition, several photos had missing data with only portions of the photo saved.  I ignored every message and sign of failure and continued using the memory card.  Many fond memories and one-of-a-kind moments lost forever.  I would give this product zero stars if possible.

I hooked up both ( bought 2)) and my Ipad2 BT connected them but they must be on the same frequency because it made them not work. I would have thought they would have been on different waves. I can only use one at a time. Hoping to put one both upstairs and downstairs. If someone has any ideas please let me know, if not, I guess I now have one I cannot use.  Thanks....bob

input: Good modem for the price.  Does not work with my CenturyLink service as this is an ADSL2+ modem and CenturyLink in my area is VDSL.

I'm extremely pleased with this purchase. Even my boyfriend said I'm surprised your fan makes absolutely no noise because I had one before and it was so loud. It can run in the middle night just in case you want to download something, keep your laptop closed and you won't hear a peep.
Super compact Laptop backpack
Love this tablet! It's so easy to use and love using the s-pen.
This case is light, strong, appears to be most durable, and I love the colors.  It is everything as promised.
Can't go wrong with a Sandisk item. I've had many and no failures. Will order Sandisk cards and drives again.
Everyone should try this one! Others are too fat and don't work well! This works very well! It has a nice slim stylus!
Arrived earlier than expected.  Very easy to set-up.  I didn't even need to have my teenage help me.  Greatly improves hi-fi sounds in the house...  Works well with Pandora.
The sound quality is excellent! Not a scratch on them. I love how they work, and I love how they look. Thanks~!

I ordered this to go along with the WD 3 TB My Book external hard drive. It arrived quickly and well-packaged and was a snap to install. Luckily, I had an extra cable lying around and things are going great. I would recommend downloading the latest drivers from Anker's site.
Works as intended. Fast ship, quick delivery, great price! Thanks...

this product was a piece of junk, that or i don't know how to use it. i hooked it all up and plugged in my computer and my ps3 and found when i went to get on line it would only run one or the other, not so big a deal, but when i wanted to use the other device i had to unplug the one and plug the other back in. waste of money, spend the $30 bucks more and get the Linksys wrt5GL, that pays off.

I absolutley LOVE my Kindle Fire. Its ease of use, portability, and wide range of applications is wonderful.

However, after about a year of use, I started having problems with it charging. At first, if I played with the USB cable it would charge, but now it is almost impossible to get it to charge.

As a final note, I have purchased a Kindle Fire HD 7\\", as a replacement for the Kindle Fire. I like it even better, but still am looking for a way to repair my first Kindle Fire.
The more memory I have the more I can practice my picture taking and hopefully I can get better at taking pictures. I am a beginner.

despite having such superior parts, this works worse than the linksys valet i replaced.
i installed this yesterday hoping to solve my network range issues, but it range is actually less than the valet and costs about 6 times as much.

waste of time and money.

input: Sellar shipped product as described. It would have been polite if the sellar had answered an email inquiry I had sent but in the end it wasn't a factor in determining the quality of the product and the satisfaction with the transaction as a whole.

I am running win7 64 bit and had a small issue with the drivers for this. I had to disable the win 7 driver update and download the driver from their page, but after 20 minutes it works great. The only issue i have noticed is the drag function doesnt work well. If you pause during a drag motion it drops icon or file where you stop moving, not when you let off the left mouse button.
Works like the $65 one at Best Buy.

Battery life only last 2 hours. Not 4 as it states...it takes a long time to boot up and connect to WiFi. ..it won't cut on half the time and keeps cutting off when u are in the middle of things....and they did not send a cord to connect to the wall adapter. I had to buy one for 15 bucks.....I bought this for my grandaughter for Christmas to keep her off my phone....she hated it.....
Doesn't cover all the corners of my tablet.

My issue is that this router loses it's security settings every time it's rebooted.  This happens a lot in my area because we have power outages a lot, so it powers back up, doesn't reload the security settings, and thus leaves a security hole in my home network.  Kind of a bad design in my opinion.  Doing a manual reset to the correct security settings is certainly possible, but seems to be finicky (it requires a login to a web-based utility) and usually takes me a few tries to get it working correctly.  Drives my wife and I crazy.    Instead of an integrated wireless/VoIP solution, I'll spend about the same money and get a better standalone wireless router and a better standalone VoIP adapter.  This one isn't worth your money.
I should never have to worry about not being able to charge my tablet ever a again.
Fast and cheap.  No more need for extra cards.  this one holds more pics than most people shoot in a week-long vacation.

This is a pretty cool little toy. I say toy because I don't see this as something you'll use for a primary home computer or anything. It does function fully like any other Windows 8.1 machine.

It has desktop mode, you can install regular windows applications (apps not through windows store). You can also use the tile start menu which works a little better since it's so small.

The only reason I didn't give the 5 stars was that when I first got it, it had a dead pixel that was hardly noticable. Even though it wasn't really noticeable except on startup, I returned it for a new one anyway. When I got the new one, it had a dead pixel too so I just gave up and am going to stick with it. HP wins this one.
Neat and good fit for the device! Good protection against damage.

My situation is special.  I ordered quantity of 3 because I knew the chances were good there were going to be 2 bad ones.  It seems the seller over-shipped in my situation, and I wound up with six Bluetooth adapters.      I just plugged in three in a row, and when they refuse to work, basically Window 7 does not recognize the device being plugged in.  I threw all malfunctioning ones into the garbage.  The 4th one I tried worked (for now)    These little Bluetooth devices are made more than likely by the tens of thousands, and I bet 1/4 of what is manufactured is a malfunctioning Bluetooth device from the get go.  Seems that way in my situation.  I started with six, threw three away, and the fourth one tried worked.    Go Figure.    I would spend a little more money and get a branded Bluetooth adapter if I need to repeat this again.
target: These adapters are a dime a dozen...1 out of 6 might work

input: I have to give five stars because it served well for what it was designed for and I am happy for the way it protects my laptop.
target: ... for what it was designed for and I am happy for the way it protects my laptop

input:
After 3 months of normal and non abusive usage, I noticed hair line cracks that loosened the magnets, Slowly in a course of a several weeks magnets would fall out and lost. Then the hairline cracks in several places would widen and chunks of plastic would crumble to pieces.

6 months later all the magnets are now gone and I developed major cracks in 7 different places.

They must of used some cheap plastics for this to happen in less than a year.

Very disappointing, I like the design of the case but the quality is ZERO.

Please send replacement. hopefully this issue has been addressed as I would like an revision.
target: ABS Plastic is made of low quality and rendered useless after 3 months.

If set to open position, while trying to close it snaps apart.  I am contacting Amazon to request a refund.  Extremely disappointed. input: This is great and works exactly as intended. I've had 100% success in both copy mode and PC mode. The copy mode is a bit slow, but that's a result of the actual hard drives, not this unit. But it certainly works reliably.
target: This is great and works exactly as intended

input: It worked perfectly and was delivered in a timely manner.

This drive was great, until it died. The power supply crapped out after a little over two years. A little research on the Internet showed that this is a common problem with this unit. The seller took several weeks to get back to me, then suggested I get a power supply on Amazon. I bought one and figured out how to install it (you better be handy to do this), and now it is back up and running. If this dies again, I am going to remove the internal hard drive and install it in a better drive enclosure.

This was a great unit when it worked--it was easy to rip my entire CD collection onto the drive--but it simply isn't made for the long haul. I expected more for $450. Buyer beware.
target: Great while it worked, but died at a young age

input: because I had my tablet located anywhere, this article meets sulabor and helps protect in case of any accident, the article met my expectations, it is of good quality.
Charger For Kindle Was Not Working. I Purchased This As A Replacement. The Charger Works Better Than The Original The Item Was Purchased With.

Looking for something small I could put into my "charger bag" to provide more outlets for the ever growing number of things that need charging when we travel.  Between at least 8 AA batteries and their two chargers, two cameras, kindle, bluetooth headphones and speaker, two iphones and an ipad, an underwater flashlight and two underwater SOLA lights we eat up outlets in a hurry.  This fits the bill perfectly.  All of the "i" stuff charges via the usb ports with no problem and the three grounded outlets are spaced well enough that I can get two eneloop "aa" chargers and a standard plug in it all at once.  Didn't overheat or balk at all when we had the whole thing filled up.  Hardly takes up any space in the charger bag!

I wanted to use my older Dell desk top with Windows XP but didn't want cables running all over.Didn't really know what to expect but was pleasantly surprised.This is a tiny little thing.I plugged it into the back of my computer,put the mini disc in and was online within ten minutes.It works well.Gets excellent signal strength and no dropped signal.So much easier and cheaper than a wireless card.This was even cheaper than buying a cable.Just wow!I am amazed at the simplicity of getting it to work.

I purchased this mostly for books (daily use) but I also use it for HBO GO & Netflix when I don't have my iPad on me. I have a ton of problems with HBO GO loading. Sometimes it'll go days with out it working. Netflix doesn't seem to have these problems. Also, I have found on numerous occasions that it will not power on when I want to use it. I have to hold the power button down for 30 seconds & restart. Since it's not my go-to tablet it's okay but I think i'd be much more disappointed if it were the only one I owned.
I love this reader ... it's quick and clear and easy to hold, easy to read and turn pages, and small enough to slide into a jacket pocket.  It's easily the best reader on the market.

However, at the time, I did not want to spend a lot of money on a case while purchasing the tablet pc.  I opted for this with "temporary" in mind.  It's been less than a month and I am ordering a much nicer case with bluetooth keyboard and all the buttons and whistle's today.  Doesn't make sense not to protect an item that I need to use a lot.  Also mine did not come with the stylus as promised.  It looks like this might have been a return; I did not even contact seller because I knew I would be buying an upgrade.  This rooCase is not durable enough for long term use.

input: Well I've learned my lesson the hard way.  The ipad is my first apple product, therefore there are things I didn't know.  Now that I've spent big bucks, I'd like some of that back!  If you're a newbie like me, DO YOUR RESEARCH.  Know what you want/need the device for.  I would love to use it for video content (for ex. TV shows I miss, pbs for the kids), but there is so much out there that Apple doesn't support (ex. - adobe flash player, which is used by tons of sites).  So, even though the show is out there on the broadcasting company website for free, I can't view it on this VERY expensive device unless there is an \\"app\\" available.  (Not to mention what a headache having to download all these apps when I should be able to use a general player to view all the content.). Oh, and I was out of town recently and tried to listen live to a radio station - couldn't do that either.
target: Too much money for too little functionality

input: came quickly and works great.

We love to listen to music and we don't want to disturb other people too in the house, good thing the seller let me get this under promotional value and was really thrilled about it. The product arrives faster than i thought. The product is light and the sound was very good. We all love this because it fits me and even my daughter can use this too. This headset is very comfortable to use.  So much happy about this product and really worth it.

I was so worried when my 8 year old got his tablet for Christmas but after purchasing this case I can safely say It could withstand a drop. It fits really well and feels solid. I've purchased gummy cases before that felt really sticky, that's not the case with this one. It's pricier that other cases but it's worth it for kids.

Pros-
It keeps my OCed i5 2500k cooler then the Hyper 212 I had on there before.
Easy install on my Phantom 410 case

Cons-
The fans are very loud at max RPM. If you're not OCing that much you can keep them on low RPM but they then make a "wub wub wub" sound that I found very annoying. I replaced the fans with a pair of Noctua F-12s and it's night and day. Paired with those this is a great budget cooler setup.

Also the Corsair Link software can be rather unstable. I've had to re-install a few times. Not really a issue with the cooler though.

Its cases are very protective and the stylus pen is a lot smaller and easier to loose than it looks. The Hard case fits the tablet the stylus pen the USB cable and the screen protector it really doesn't fit the charger you have to literally jam it in there and it makes it look puffy on the outside otherwise its the perfect size for carrying and portable and shiny looking!!

If you use Mac Ox 10.10 (Yosemite) do not even bother, Logitech has not yet provided a solution on how to get this camera to work on the current Mac operating system. In the online support forum they even admit its only working on 10.7 - 10.8. Unbelievable that a company wis unable to make their flagship product work with the operating system that is on every new Mac. This thing is therefore outdated unless Logitech gets their act together.
target: Does NOT work with Mac Os 10.10 (Yosemite)

input:
Normally, when you buy a screen protector, they include a little plastic squeegee thing to help you push out all the bubbles. You don't need it with this screen protector. They DO provide you with two cleaning cloths (a wet and a dry one) to prepare your screen before you put on the film.

After I cleaned the screen, it was amazing that the film just went on smoothly with absolutely NO bubbles. It took a few seconds to apply the film and I was done! What a difference from the time I've spent pushing bubbles with other films; and no cursing!

I am so pleased with the product. It is virtually finger print proof, unless your fingers are a dirty. But they provide a lint free cleaning cloth for that! The film also cuts down the glare quite a bit. It is hard to see any loss of clarity of the display between when the film is applied and with no film.

I would highly recommend this product!
target: Wow - When they say no bubbles...

input: It is very good item it work with my laptop and now I can play  my laptop for long time

Hands down, it's the easiest router that I've ever setup for myself or my friends. I was able to connect to my work VPN and the internet within about 15 minutes after configuring the internet connection and the security settings. I didn't see where I was able to make it not broadcast the network name. I also find that the range isn't quite as strong as the range was on my previous Netgear router but it's still sufficient. I'm looking forward to the Almond+ which will have about 2x the range of this router.

All in all, a great router at a great price. I recommend it.
target: Easy to setup, good performance, decent range

input: I have had this in operation since my main drive crashed about 6 months ago.  I have been using it to routinely backup my now recovered system.  Has been simple and straightforward to use. I don't particularly like their bundled software but that may be more a matter of taste.  It works and I have had NO issues with the unit. The PRICE pushed me over the edge to buy this thing. 2 TB of storage for under $160 (when I bought it) - hard to beat!!! Then again, I still remember the days when a 10 Meg Winchester was a big deal.

input:

I wanted to buy Bose GS II but had no money. I am not an idiot to compare 40$ speaker set to a 500$ one.

I have had many, 2.1, 5.1 etc... out of all the 2.1 systems, This is worth every penny. It does not look cheap. and sounds amazing.

input:
This screen is NOT compatible with the Asus G72GX-RBBX05, as the listing says. The connector for this screen is on the opposite side of the cable in the laptop, meaning you have to get an adapter of some sorts or wire it yourself somehow, neither of which the seller states in their listing. It might be a great screen, but it doesn't work with the laptop it's advertised for.

Also, seller expects me to pay for shipping both ways, despite their false advertising.

EDIT: I actually got an adapter cable to move the connector to the right side of the screen, and it still did not work. I then ordered a screen from a different seller, which was also advertised to work with the G72, and also had a resolution of 1920 x 1080, and it worked. So basically this seller is falsely advertising compatibility and their customer service did not provide a full refund (including shipping) when I made them aware of it. Amazon, however, DID provide a full refund.
target: Does not work with the G72GX-RBBX05

input: My BF (age 22) is a lifelong Transformers fan and collector, and he was ecstatic to receive this for Valentine's Day! It not only transforms, but is also a functioning USB flash drive. He put the [[ASIN:B00000I01C The Transformers: The Movie - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]] on it and plugged it into his car stereo, and now Ravage helps him rock out every day on his way to work. Not for kids, but rather the adult TF fans who are still kids at heart. :)

input: My laptop is 5 years old and was getting hot after about an hour or two.  The Cooler Master NotePal LapAir keeps it cooler for several hours more.  It still gets warm, but not hot.  And it is great for my lap.  My lap does not get hot.  I would have purchased it just for keeping my legs from burning.

This Kindle Fire was sent as a replacement for one that I got 2 years ago for Christmas. The first one had a problem with not charging because the port was wiggly and loose. I don't know if that was a structural defect in mine, or if it was a common problem in the first generation Kindles. I called customer service, they ran me through some troubleshooting, and after determining the problem they sent me a BRAND NEW Kindle in the mail. I got it 2 days later and sent my broken one back. They paid for the shipping and everything. Absolutely a breeze. No problems with this one! I love my Kindle.

The Kingston 4gb SDHC memory card, like all other Kingston products, is an exceptional piece of equipment.  I use it with my Canon SD1000 and I get nothing but blazing fast write times and no headaches.  Make sure your device supports SDHC because if not, it will not work.  This is a key reason why people are left \\"unsatisfied\\" by what they get, not because of the product, but because they did not do their homework.    Buyers, you should really take note that, most reviews on any site about not only Kingston, but other great brands, is heavily altered by idiot customers leaving comments to attack the site that sold them the items.  So don't quickly judge an product based on how many stars it has, because honestly, you cannot take that into consideration unless you have read every review posted.
target: Don't be swayed by idiot customers..
