input: Arrived in a timely manner in good condition.  Nice texture and good fit.  I assume that it is really leather since that's what the description says but will have to wait until there's some wear and tear before I can comment on the durability.

This is a wonderful little protective pack for travel for JUST your ipad-mini. . . but it will only hold your ipad-mini.  It will not fit anything extra- example- if you have a cover or if you have a keyboard.  Also, it comes with an extra pocket for your iphone and it doesn't fit in there either.  For the price, it's a great travel pouch.
target: This is a wonderful little protective pack for travel for JUST your ipad-mini

input: I used this to run power in my golf cart from a dash mounted USB port to a Bluetooth speaker mounted near the roof. The 2 meters was just enough extra length to make it all the way around the windshield frame.
I use this product daily. Very pleased. Have recommended this  product to several people
target: Very pleased. Have recommended this product to several

input: Horrible, the windows was a fake on it.
The Kindle Touch is my first Kindle. I think that the Marware case is an excellent fit.  The Marware case is a good choice.

I just came back from vacation and the I could barely get one bar on my laptop for the wifi in my hotel room. It was frustrating. I started looking for a wifi adapter when I returned home and decided to pull the trigger on this highly reviewed unit.

I received the item in two days, unboxed it and windows installed it automatically without using the included mini cd.

The results... Amazing! I went from seeing five wireless hotspots with only two of them registering any signal quality worth mentioning on my internal wifi card to 20 wifi locations using this device. Almost all of them were four to five bars.

Bottom line: This device works, and works very well. I highly recommend this device.

I posted a video on youtube unboxing and reviewing it on my channel HDiNDEMAND.

I got these to have as a low power speaker for the computer in my office for soft listening. I intentionally went with a set that doesn't have a subwoofer, as the whole office can hear a sub when its on, even at low volume. I got these, and I am very pleasantly surprised. They are exactly what I was looking for. Not a whole lot of bass response, but full enough to sound nice. They were a little mid-heavy, so I used the iTunes EQ to pull back the mids a bit, and now they sound great. Seriously a great buy for less than $25, you won't get this kind of quality with the others in this price range. (logitech, etc..) Quit reading this review and go ahead and add to cart.
target: Can't beat it for this price. highly recommended.

input: I bought this for my iPad Air 2 because it was the closest in size to the dimensions of the iPad.  It is a bit bigger than the device, so this will not work if you are looking for a tight fit.  I do not have any kind of a case on the iPad, so the fit may be better if you have a case.  It is easy to get the iPad into and out of the sleeve and keeps it nicely cushioned while in my work bag or purse.

Received this and really liked it.  For the money, fantastic.  Backlight is fine.  I'm not sure why all the complaints.  Looks good to me.  Maybe not as good as the advertising pictures, but good all the same.  It has the "xray" feature which explains who characters are and the locations of said characters in the book.  You can highlight, make notes and download books with wifi.  My problem is that after opening it up a few times, downloading some books and giving to my mom for christmas, she took it home, used it a couple times then at the swipe to open screen...  It wouldn't "swipe to open".  I sent it back and got credit for it. I gave my mom my 1st gen Kindle Fire and bought the Fire HD (which I was contemplating in the first place.)  If you don't get a dud (I did) I think it would be a great way to read

I bought this product almost 2 months ago, i use to record tennis players and so far it has been great. Very easy to set up, the ipad mini fits perfectly in the slot and the tripod does exactly what it's supposed to!
Works as expected. plugged it in and started up no problems at all. build seems to be sturdy enough. thanks.
I bought three of these so I'd have one in each of my camera bags and travel stuff. These work very well!
target: Great Cables - Works well and the Price is Right!

input:
I bought this a couple of weeks ago and am really glad I did. I have an Acer laptop with a basic level processor that's at least 4 years old. Upgraded to 4GB of RAM but I still had slow performance problems for years. I recently upgraded to this SSD Drive and my start-up time went from 2 minutes to 20 - 30 seconds. Internet Browsing is faster, programs open way faster, I can open files instantly, and even Photoshop starts up way faster. Battery life is improved! Just as I hoped.

I would recommend this to anyone with a slow computer unwilling to spend $800+ on a new one.

Awesome and just what I need to connect my tripod to me PC camera!
Five stars all the way here.. They are fantastic!
I bought the Masque protective film cover for my Kindle Fire,it works great and fits perfectly.I also got it much sooner than i expected.

I didn't expect much from this, and that's exactly what I got. It won't crumble in your hand and it works well. And as I only needed it to salvage a few old hard drives it's no problem. I wouldn't want this as the solution for multiple uses however.
target: Cheap and flimsy but it does the job.

input: Just as described, great quality!
small and convenient!

SanDisk user for  years, but love the new 1066x Lexar Professional CF memory cards. They are the new card of choice for all of my photography needs. I use them with my Canon EOS 5D Mark III and Canon EOS 5D (Mark I).
I purchased the Kindle Fire when it first came out and loved it but it does not compare to the Kindle Fire HD!  I love it!
target: I am so happy I purchased this item

input: For ten year old daughter. Limited time for learning.researching,fun loving,commuting with friends, and teaching younger sister to have fun with the games.
Great tablet, fast service,would recommend. Thanks.
Beautiful Case all of my friends compliment it.  The Case does a great job of protecting my case, during routine use by my kids.
Excellent rigid case for protecting your hard drive. It's the best hard drive case I have purchased to date. I would not hesitate to recommend to a freind.

I like it so far. I don't game or anything, I just have browsers and other software running and everything looks as it should. Every now and then I see a weird flicker on it but I'm not sure if its the monitor or my video card. It doesn't happen often and it's no big deal right now anyway. Just thought I'd mention it in case there are other reports of the same thing.

Beautiful bag, but rather heavy. It is, in fact, heavier than the Mac Book Air I bought it to carry! However, it's very stylish, and doesn't look like a laptop bag. It also doesn't look like something a college student would carry around, and I like that.

Shoulder straps are VERY stiff. I hope they soften with use.

Was a great purchase. Gives my tablet more flexibility. Would suggest everyone getting for your tablet.
It shipped on time also

Funny thing is I have the same cover as my daughter who lives with me.  It was great and I searched hard for one unique to me.  It ends up we both loved this one and bought them without realizing they were the same.  Hey great taste alike.:)
target: Great color and look and feel

input: Not "Michael Kors" item, but it works exactly as described, and at a very low price.  Nuttin' more to say...
target: Got MORE than I paid for

input: I ordered this twice - neither of the units worked. First one wouldn't charge, the second one charged but wouldn't connect. I am annoyed as I live in Canada - but had to have this delivered and picked up from the States. I had to pay pay Canada customs on taxes/duties for two product that have now been returned. Time spent calling Amazon, wrapping up the return, going to the post office etc. etc. - a total waste. I have noticed that a lot of reviews since the beginning of the year are pretty much the same as mine - product didn't work. Maybe the vendor had a bad batch of product - but I am disappointed as this process has taken almost two months - and I still don't have a case/keyboard for the Tablet I was given for Christmas. I loved the design of the Blurex case - but recommend you pass on it until the company can put out a product that works.
target: Gave it two shots - but it doesn't work

input:
Product worked for about 5 minutes (and it has nothing to do with charging - its up to loose shoddy connections).
Its the typ[e of product you buy to take on your next trip - its not something you use at home, therefore must be reliable.
This one is poor quality and you cant catch the fault at home unless you prcatice reading without lights.
So once you know it doesnt work - you dont have it for your trip , and you are way out of the faulty item return window!
target: Very unreliable quality on an item normally purchased for travel

input:
I teach computing/Internet to seniors and this is the perfect computer for them. They do not have to worry about updates or malware/virus protection. I have found they can pick up most of what they need to know in 2 weeks time without any prior computer knowledge. I have my own Chromebook and with their permission I can sign in to their accounts on mine and assist them remotely. That is very handy because we are only in the same location in the winter in South Texas. Most seniors want Facebook, email, Google search and Kindle for PC. Once they have that down pat they are happy. Chromebook is the perfect tool for them and me.
Another point I want to make is that the apps include most anything you would want to do on any computer. I have yet to find anything I cannot do.

I received a Xoom for Mother's Day and with three kids under 4 I knew I needed something to protect my new gadget. My black rooCASE is a perfect fit! It is exactly as described, fits snuggly and is good quality. My only concern is the lack of access to the volume keys on the upper left. That is the only down side. Good product!
Very happy with this keyboard/mouse combo
I decided on this tablet because i wanted the nook as well as kindle.  I got exactly what I wanted.  The wireless keyboard made it the perfect combination.
target: I researched the tablets for a long while before buying.

input:
Should have done just a little more research on ARM processor. Doesn't run x86 apps.

Great tablet otherwise.
Outstanding! Product arrived on time, in great shape, and ready to use. No issues
target: in great shape, and ready to use

input: Hard drive works well

Find all \\"smart\\" crap irritating and intrusive.  Got this as gift -- loaded my first book and fell for it -- one hand to turn page -- able to mark places easily.  There are books I want to collect and save and this will be for all the others....

This was a gift and the recipient loves it.
The size and quality in construction should provided years of convenient use.

I was hesitant to purchase this keyboard because it is wireless.  I work full shifts on my computer, often working overtime, so I cannot afford to have batteries die in the midst of a shift as was my experience with past wireless keyboards.  I sure hope this one lives up to its long battery life reputation because the comfort of this keyboard is amazing.  I have a lot of hand and arm pain so I have to be very careful about my keyboard selection.  This one has a great shape that does not overextend my fingers, which is a major issue with some ergonomic keyboards.  The keys have a slight texture, almost feeling like brushed leather, which is very comfortable.  The keys are very quiet, which is important to me (I cannot stand a loud keyboard because it is a distraction while transcribing).  I do have to get accustomed to the location of the "End" button, but I like the extended size of the "Delete" key.  I highly recommend this keyboard for someone with smaller hands who must avoid RSI, or needs to pamper themselves due to an RSI.
target: Should have purchased one long ago!

input: The product came as advertised and had the component I needed to accomplish the networking task for which it was intended.

I ordered the advertised Corsair brand memory, but received Crucial brand memory in place of it. The vendor did not ask me if the substitution was okay. I have had to repeatedly RMA Crucial memory sticks over the years, due to unexplained failures, blue screens, sudden reboots, Etc., so I was not happy with this unexpected substitution by the vendor. I would have canceled the order, if given the opportunity. While both brands have lifetime warranties to the original owner, this was used memory that I received, not new. I don't know if Crucial will honor their warranty if the memory fails. Either way I would have to pay the return shipping to send the substituted brand back. I have been ordering tech products for over 30 years and cannot remember a vendor ever pulling a stunt like this one did. This is clearly a case of bait with a high quality brand and then switch shipping an inferior brand. I would never order any products from Nemix again.
Love this backpack!  Carries my small HP laptop for work!  So many compliments in the purple color!!!
This product is Solid and does not scratch the screen like other cases with keyboards does. Wish it came in more colors.
I think I will be using this case for a very long time. So easy to install and work with. 10/10 Would buy again!
no battery was just not functional. started to work fine but after second charge it failed to recharge
target: started to work fine but after second charge it failed to recharge

input: Has worked seamlessly in the month I have had it.  No connection problems and works well.

I wish I could choose no stars

Keybaord works for a while, then stops working. I purchased 2 of them at the same time and both do this. The small light on the kb that shows you PC has power goes out and comes back on when you start to type which is different that any kb I have ever used.

TOO often the light goes out as if PC was shut off and KB cable needs to be pulled and plugged into a different USB port. My pc NEVER had a problem with the other kb's and I only bought these because mine was getting a little dirty.

I would not recommend these at all, unless you don't mind having to unplug them from your PC and plug them back in.

I will be requesting a refund on both I purchased.
target: Skip this deal - I bought 2 and both have same issue

input: When opened, cover blocks camera lens.

This is one of the best deals I was able to find on a 64GB SD card, as far as rating and price per byte.

The card has worked fine in my Lenovo Thinkpad Twist laptop and my Raspberry Pi single-board computer (using NOOBS). I've performed several partition and formatting operations in Windows 8 without problems. I'm quite happy with transfer speeds so far.

The only problem I've run into is trying to use the card to run RACHEL-Pi on my Raspberry Pi after writing the installation image to the card using Win32 Disk Imager. The Pi would not boot. However, I can't say that this was definitely any problem with the card.
target: Excellent price, no criticism to offer

input: I like this quite a great deal. The only reason for four out of five is because it might be nice if there were little elastic kind-of-straps or something to maybe hold it into place.  It is rather slippery is all. Great design, other than that, and is nice to not have to plug this in.
target: Unique cooling pad with no need for any kind of plugs

input: This thing is great! Super accurate, comfortable. Yes,  it looks like a knock off Razer mouse (I mean even the name is Fazer, and the R looks like some snake fangs). BUT, it really does hold its own. This has accurate movements within ~25  feet. I can lay in bed and play Diablo on my TV across the room (yes, with a small about of lag). But the thing just works. I've enjoyed it so much as the house, I've actually brought it to work with me. If it had a spot to store the USB dongle, I'd probably take it everywhere in my bag.
target: It works, and it works very well!

input:
I am giving this product 5 stars because I have had absolutely no problems with it since I got it. Except on the initial setup trying to connect to my ISP via my DSL line since it is a PPPOE connection. I had some wrong information about my PPPOE settings from my ISP so everytime I tried to connect I would get errors. That was all fixed with a quick call to my earthlink customer support.
The wireless portion of this router was where I thought I'd have problems, but it turned out everything worked like it was supposed to right out of the box. I was pleasantly surprised to see how easy and quickly I was able to get my laptop up and running on the internet. There are some advanced settings that deal with performance on the wireless end, but since everything is working fine, I have no desire to mess around and accidently break something.
target: One problem with PPPOE turned out to be with ISP

input: This cover did not fit my kindle despite the fact the description said it would.  It was just a tad too small, therefore knocking a start.  However, shipping was good, return was quick, and i did like the cover.  I wish it had fit.  I have the 7 inch kindle fire HD.
Got these cables for their long reach. They lasted about one month then stopped working.  Now I just use the short cable with a USB extender.

I bought this to use with all my midi controllers and it works great. Has almost to many plugs and I was surprised on how big it was when I got it. Good for at home maybe not so good for traveling. It all works awesome and the flip up USB slots are genius.

This combo router/modem worked ok, but I wanted more control over my settings and updates without the interference from Comcast. I returned it for the Netgear N750 dual band gigabit router and a separate SurfBoard SB6141 DOCSIS 3.0 cable modem for a few extra dollars. Also, the interface for the N450 is terrible.
target: Returned it for the Netgear N750 for more options.

input: I purchased this product with high hopes of keeping my iPad charged when needed and my cell phone. Unfortunately it did not last 6 mos. The case strap broke so I could no longer prop my pad up as it was supposed to be. On top of that the battery charger stopped working!!! I am furious with this product because I thought this was going to be great and convenient. Also the battery is extremely heavy. Lastly, there is no way to know if the battery is fully charged because there is no indicator. This product needs to go back to the drawing board!!! I want my money back!!!!
Broke easily.

I was a bit skeptical in purchasing this product because of some of the reviews. The bottle and towel are a bit smaller than expected, but honestly it works wonders. I use this product to clean my laptop and even glasses. I can honestly say it works amazing on my glasses as well as laptop. It was worth the purchase!
target: Awesome product, though it is very small

input:
Pros: its a working mouse.

Cons: HORRIBLE Horrible horrible build quality. this mouse feels like if you play a game where you smash the mouse button or use a semi auto weapon it will crush under your fingers. [but why the helicopter would you be playing a game on here???]
Mouse buttons started to not function, had to press a billion times or incredibly, INCREDIBLY hard for 1 click.

this mouse would make a great mouse if yours dies and you need something temporarily for browsing the web or business.
but there is literally no point in buying this online. if it was at an airport or trainstation and you just need it for a little that would make sense. but to purchase this online is dumb. when there are plenty of other options....
Hands down the best cat5e's I've ever used. I'll never go back.
Do not buy this. Freezes, shuts off for no reason, keypad worped, very short battery life.
I am so pleased with this new purchase.  It is easy to read, easy to carry and the battery life is amazing!

My grandson enjoys the Kids Shock Proof Foam Handle Case/Stand for Kindle HD 7". It is easy for him to carry and stand for use. The issue with the case are the openings for volume and power. The openings on the case do not line up properly with the ports on the Kindle HD 7". I find we are constantly removing the case to make adjustments or charging.
target: It is easy for him to carry and stand for use

input: This is a well made, sturdy case. There is room for the charger, note pad, pens and/or pencils.  You can carry it by the handle or use the strap and hang it from the shoulder if your hands aren't free.

Unlike most other PCs/Tablets/Notebooks in this price point, this computer did NOT come with a trial version of Microsoft Office (Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Access, etc.). If you buy it, it is $6.99 per month for one computer (or $69.99 for the year - if you pay all-at-once). I would have chosen another computer, had this been clear (my fault; dangerous assumption, I suppose).

The chicklet keyboard feels pretty cheap (plastic) and unlike other laptops, you have to hold the function botton down to use volume buttons, brightness buttons, etc. on the top row of keys.

One other little annoyance is there is NO USB port on the right side of the computer. If you want to attach an external mouse (if, like me, you are annoyed with the touchpad); you better use a wireless mouse, or the cord must be draped in front (or behind) the whole laptop (for anyone right-handed).
excellent replacement battery.  Fits like a glove, charged up right away and works like a charm
installed and cycled per instructions, less than 3 weeks later turned on laptop and it said could not find battery, removed and reinstalled 3 times and it still would not recognize battery.
Very good quality,comfortable and afordable. The only thing they should include is builtin mp3.
target: Very good quality, comfortable and afordable

input: Would buy from this selller again.  Product matched description and it's the best price I found on one of these.
target: GREAT PRODUCT GREAT PRICE FAST SHIPPING THANKS!!!!

input: I'm not please with this product for the follow reason. The protective coating on the end of the cord has separated from end of the plug exposing the wiring. Would not recommend you buy this product. Would rather purchase the cord from Dell and pay the mark up price than the discount price.
Looks good and protects well. It is a little difficult to access the exterior buttons. Also hard to make contact with the edge of the screen sometimes. Overall it is a nice case.
It did not fit the ipad2 properly at all, one corner kept popping out. I purchased another Ctech case in replacement.

This iPad cover is just what I wanted. It stands up the screen at two angles in either portrait or landscape style. Definitely better than that useless magnet one Apple peddles...hurts my neck staring down at it, as its not actually a stand...

This cord has the eight-sided (octagonal) connector plug (as opposed to round) for a Dell Inspiron 1545 (which apparently, you can no longer get from Dell--I tried and it was a joke) and fits my computer just the way the old one did. This came with both parts of the cord (the wall plugin side and the computer plugin side with the box thing on it). The only difference with this one is that it is shorter than the one my laptop originally came with. I read a lot of reviews that said this charger charges really hot or makes their battery hot. My old charger did that, and I haven't noticed that with this charger yet but if anything changes I'll edit this review. Some also said that it would power their computer but would not charge the battery. My battery icon currently says \\"Plugged in, charging,\\" so it seems to be working. Again, if anything changes I will update this review. Thus far the cord seems to be working just fine. Item is as described, great price.

This keyboard and mouse worked fairly well until recently.  Now the mouse has gone bonkers.  The scroll key works intermittently.  I have to use the keyboard arrows, or press down on the roller wheel, at which point a funny icon pops up, and mvoing the mouse ever so slighly causes the screen to scroll like a rocket, until you push the roller wheel again, when it then reverts to a no scrolling mode.  It has jst about rendered itself useless, and I will go back over to my old Logitech wired setup, as this keyboard mouse assembly has frayed my nerves and wasted my eyeballs and zapped my productive time like crazy.  There ought to be a law, demanding full documentation of whatever is causing this.
target: at which point a funny icon pops up

input: Very nice speakers at first. I like the bass and treble. Can turn up my iphone and it doesn't distort. After a year of use one of the speakers quit working. Not very happy with this purchase.
target: Great Sound, but one of the speakers quit working

input:
I love this thing. I was resistant to learning another technology but Hambone insisted. Love it.
Mrs Hambone

Bought a 100-pack of these at a local electrical supply store. Worst RJ45 jacks I've ever used. The package states for stranded wire. All the Cat5e UTP cable I've ever used has been solid -- not stranded -- wire.  Do not attempt to use this wire with solid cable. Period.  I've gone through about a dozen of these so far and still haven't made a working patch cable. Fifteen years of experience in networking, and I've never had this much trouble with cabling. Not even on my first day on the job...  These may be great for stranded cable. I don't know as I've ever seen stranded Cat5/Cat5e/Cat6 cable.  Good luck if you buy these.
Love this product, I would like to have 1 in every color for my Kindle.
It doesn't fit Galaxy. Tab 2 7.0. It's ok. It does the job. Recommend another buyer if you are trying to fit this tablet.
target: Not a perfect fit but it does work.

input: I just wish now I'd bought two or three! This works with so much stuff. I got this for my Kindle for recharge....little did I know you can plug all sorts of electronic's into it. Hot diggity darn!! I have used this with my Sony reader too! Well any way you get the picture.Just great for the money. Easy to pack along also. Great product for the price. You will not be dissapointed.

I received this charger adapter for my Microsoft Surface Pro and after just 3 days. I noticed that the wiring had burned through the cord right after the transformer in one spot. Now it makes a really annoying high-frequency shrieky noise when it's plugged in. Very disappointed in this product.

I got a Kindle keyboard for Christmas 2010.  I bought a red lighted cover at the end of December.  It protects the Kindle's screen and makes it much easier for me to find when I set it down and forget where I put it.  I don't think the cover is too heavy.  I carry my kindle with me almost everywhere, and the cover has done a great job of protecting it.    One of the hinges broke in late October.  The Kindle wouldn't stay in the cover and the light didn't want to work.  I contacted the Kindle customer support from my Kindle page, NOT the regular Amazon customer support.  I was able to get live support.  Once I explained the problem, the rep placed an order for a new cover and sent me a label to mail back the broken one.  I had the new cover in days.    I couldn't be happier. I think the cover was worth the price.
Works exactly as advertised. The image is a bit blurry but it beats having to buy a TV. Sound is satisfactory as well.
Works well, but placement of usb;s poor. Should be near back.

input: I like the look of this case and it adds very little build to the iPad. It matches the pink Apple Smart Cover perfectly. In combination, they make a nice looking case for the iPad. However, I recently noticed that the one of the corners was broken off. I am not sure how this happened because my iPad has never been dropped. I carry it in a padded backpack to school, but I am otherwise very careful with it. So while this case looks nice, I'm not sure the quality or design is there.

I give this a 2 out of 5 stars because the case is wonderful...At least before the zipper breaks. It was poorly designed and the zipper catches on the case every time you use it. So after around 4-5 uses, my zipper now refuses to slide past certain points along its path. I would recommend looking elsewhere for a carrying case.
Good inexpensive battery deliverd in a timely manner. It fit my computer like the original one. Now I can use my computer in the shower without it being plugged in so I won't electrocute myself.
The product has even better battery life than the original battery that came with my laptop. Previously, I could only go maximum of 20 minutes on my battery. Now, I can go almost 2 hours.

I have a 15" Retina MacBook Pro. I first tried the 15" sleeve, which was much bigger than what my laptop needs. By the listed dimensions, the 14" sleeve should have been fine, but it was too small. Its dimensions were nearly identical to those listed for the 13-inch sleeve. Thinking Amazon may have shipped the wrong item (especially after talking with a rep on the phone), I returned it for another. Same dimensions. Both came in a box labeled as a 14-inch sleeve, but either the label was wrong, or the dimensions given on the site are off.
Great item I like the fact I only need to close the cover and the Kindle shuts down
IT'S Look and fits like the one I got/brought with my product.It don't fall out when i plug it in.

I bought the Kindle for my wife who's in a book club and the downloaded copies are cheaper. I'm 67 and retired and read quite a bit myself, at least two novels a week and didn't think reading a novel from a six inch screen would appeal to me. Tried hers and I loved it. Bought my own.  A friend lent me his hardback copy of The Girl Who kicked the Hornet's Nest and I found myself wishing it was on the Kindle.  I've become spoiled.  Very Truly Yours,  Pete
For my granddaughter, and she loves it. She loves to read!

I love it! I have refused to download Facebook and have been able to get some great reading in. It is fast, convenient and easy to access and carry. It DOES everything then some :-) Thanks Husband for the thoughtful gift!

input:
The mouse works fine. Keyboard has emotional issues.

Press the left shift button, and you get a >

For geeks like me for whom computers and technology put bread on the table (I'm an UNIX Systems Engineer) this was a no biggie ... remapping the keys is done in a matter of seconds.

so no 5 stars. Sorry

input:
I have this mouse for 4 years, never has any problem, except the rubberized surface warn out, very reliable. I was motivated to write this review as my new Creative Lab Fatal1ty 1010 mouse dead after 3 months, and I need to pay over $30 to get repaired, Forget about it!

This is not fancy, but very reliable. So I buy another kensington wireless mouse, so far very satisfied.
fits for the most part. However, beware that this item does not ship with adhesive. You will have to provide your own when replacing the original bezel.

Works great, just love it.  Would buy it over again!  Can't say enough to let you know it's worth it!
bad product, not original, different from what it offers, I delay sending one month, not recommended.
Great product. Work like a charm. And very easy to use

I thought that the razer kraken pro was a high qualtiy headset however, the amount of length in cord they give you is ridiculous. you would need to find some way to shorten it and I partially broke mine because the wire was on the floor and my chair crushed it. It still works due to the high protective rubber coating. I highly recommend it. The looks are extremely nice and very worth it.
This is a VERY nice cable. It is light, flexible yet strongly made. I'm really glad I got two of them!
An impractical purchase on a whim, but I do enjoy using it when the need arises.  Works great.

input: Great affordable HD webcam. Crystal clear picture! It definitely isn't a wide angle lens, though. I can't move around as much and still remain in frame.
Bought this as a gift and it does not charge as quickly as my mom would like. But keeping it.

Thirdly, the protective sheet still had scraps from the (two?) punch-out holes for the camera. These scraps got under the sheet upon application and it's never been quite the same since. That is, the bubbles just never seem to be completely eliminated. The screen still works just fine, I just need to get over the little bubbles up around the camera. It doesn't affect the display.

That said, it's a nice product. I get compliments about the color (blue) and the feel. The plug is ideal. All in all, it works fine.

input: Well this may have a good rep as a laptop hdd but as a component in a certain (cough..cough) Imation external USB 3.0 hdd it sucks. Just look up the Apollo M-100 ext hdd. Mine lasted about 9 months of light use before the heads stuck. Characterised by a solid blue read light and beeping coming from the enclosure. Had to do a non-clean room disassembly and move the heads with a pair of forceps. Worse than useless for external storage (as unreliable) but might be OK as a lappie or desktop drive as it might not get such a rough ride. Wouldn't recommend to a friend!
target: Might be ok in your laptop but don't survive well in an external enclosure

This would not be a real problem if you were given the choice of paying in either Euro,Dollar or GBP.We are paying significantly more for books than people are in the UK.I would love to know hoe Amazon calculate their conversion rates.This was NOT pointed out at the time of purchase,and I would urge people to look carefully before buying a kindle,then if you decide to go ahead and get one of them I would further urge you to look in Tesco or PC world because they can sell the Amazon product cheaper than Amazon.!!!  I will be very interested if this review is posted on the Amazon site.They requested a review,so now let us see how much they value my opinion.  John Byrne.

Since March of 2010 Pogoplug users have been asking the company to modify the the logon script for the website so it would allow interfacing with two very popular password managers: 1Password and Lastpass. They company has failed to respond to this request. Instead the company choses to edit the posts of their users when they complain about the issue instead of responding with something constructive like \\"we're working on it,\\" or \\"there's a technical reason why this can't be done right now.\\"    This is only one example. Users have issued requests for changes in file and folder permissions to no avail.    The shame about this is the product is pretty neat. It really allows you to build an economical cloud using your own high-speed Internet. For me, however, the inaction of the company ruined the user experience.    I highly recommend looking into a service like Memopal, which offers economical cloud-based file storage and sharing instead of Pogoplug.
target: Has potential, but the company is not responsive to customer needs.

I like computers and use them all the time but I'm not networking savy. I was very fearful of leaving me home PC directly connected to our cable modem (AT&T @home) without a firewall. I also needed to connect my work laptop to the Internet and share files with the home PC. The Netgear was perfect for us.
It took about 15 minutes to set up only because @home in our area uses "static IP address". If this applies to you, don't worry, AT&T gave you this info on your original order. Also, Netgear instructions show you how to retrieve it from your PC if you can't find the paperwork. It sets up via Internet Explorer and the router prompts you to enter the information. For DHCP users, its even easier as this is the default for the router. It took longer to reboot my PC after changing its settings than setting up the router.
It was a great buy. After 1 month, we're very happy with it.
target: Great, simple router for the home

input:
Bought two of them. One stopped being recognized after about 8 months (powers Dell laptop but not recognized so doesn't charge battery). Got my full money back since it was still under warranty.

I believe the problem is in the third (innermost) wire inside the plug that sends the digital signal ID telling the DELL laptop that the charger is valid. Either their is a break somewhere in the wire or the chip that generates the ID inside the adapter is fried. The problem is mostly DELL's fault for requiring an ID to charge which is more about increasing the sales of DELL-branded adapters than providing any type of added (protection).

So while I blame the adapter manufacturer in part for making a cheap adapter (but hey I only paid about 6.50), I blame Dell just as much for their anti-competitive tricks.
target: Stopped being recognized by DELL laptop after 8 months

The monitor I received as an A0 version but manufactured in July of 2014. I ordered it in October of 2014 so clearly this is current product. I suspect the versions indicated the plant where the monitor was manufactured not the technology in the unit. My monitor has an excellent picture and no buzzing. The only area that I feel needs clarifying is that the monitor can only display WQHD (1440) graphics on Dual Link DVI graphics interfaces with the Dual Link DVI cable or the Displayport. The VGA and HMDI interfaces cannot go past HD resolution. This resulted in my needing to get a suitable graphics card and cable. This can be harder than it seems as most DVI are single link. I found an EVGA card with an Nvidia GeForce GT610 GPU with 1 GB of ram works fabulously with my standard HP Pavillion power supply and delivers excellent performance. However, I am not gaming full screen and full resolution most of the time but instead doing Photo editing and CAD work.

Bottom line: This is an excellent monitor with a minor restriction.
target: My monitor has an excellent picture and no buzzing

Boy, this is a great product! I just received it, and was a little hesitant to open it, since I was positive it wouldn't work with my RoadRunner connection. (Most products such as direct connections to a hub don't work; connection sharing refused to cooperate)
Anyway, since I couldn't resist, I ripped open the seal, and removed all the packaging. It was so easy to set up that it actually took longer to open the box! All I did was connect my router to my 3Com hub, and my modem to the RT311. I re-powered both units, and I was flying on the net.
The product comes with a web-based configuration utitlity, but my computer automatically recognized the connection. Troubleshooting is easy with the online wizard, and the product comes with 24x7 tech support. This has been the best network purchase I've made in a while, and I will definately continue to purchase with NetGear, so it's the perfect place to buyit. I LOVE this product!! :-)

I had purchased WD external hard drives in the past and had mixed experiences. However, the reviews on the My Passport Essential SE were decent so I bought the 1TB product.

a) When I hooked it up, straight out of the box, I got a messag saying that I had to install firmware. I tried several times and it didn't seem to take. So, I gave up. Nevertheless, the back ups worked so I thought (silly me) that I was in the clear
b) The computer would intermittently not recognize the drive. I would disconnect and reconnect and eventually my PC would recognize it
c) Now it doesn't recognize it at all. The user forums seems to suggest that the drive has crashed.

I've had this less than a year. Less than 10% of the drive is being utilized. I was using this device as an alternate backup source.

Forget WD. I will never buy another product they make.
target: Unreliable.. don't buy it if you value your data

Lastly the stand is a bit awkward, and tilt is somewhat difficult, but installation of the screen into the stand was a breeze. All around, a definite 4 star unit.

input:
The lighting is almost perfect, but you can see the 4 leds at the bottom of the screen, in particular the shadows between the leds.
This draws away your attention from the text, taking away a bit of pleasure.

One way to correct it is to glue a black ribon at the bottom of the screen to cover the distracting shadows.
You will not be able to see the location in the book, but you won't see anymore the leds.

I do wonder why the diffusion layer do not start a bit further in the case, so that the shadows would not be visible.
target: The lighting at the bottom of the screen distracts the reader

My neighborhood is full of WiFi networks. Some of my neighbors' routers jump from channel to channel, causing intermittent interference.

I have a lot of devices in my house. Any device that is relatively stationary (printer, Z-wave controller, PC, IP camera) is plugged into one of these little gems, as they are immune to WiFi interference. Set up is easy. Just follow the directions. I have found that they will not work if plugged into surge suppressors (the instructions said so, but I had to try) or z-wave controlled outlets (these create interference).

The only reason I don't give these adapters five stars is that they have to be unplugged and replugged periodically (monthly, quarterly?) to keep the network up and running. That's my first shot at troubleshooting if a Powerline AV connected device loses network connectivity. Start by unplugging the one connected to your router, then go around and unplug/replug the 'client' adapters.
target: In a world gone mad with WiFi signals...

Extended ethernet cable to a 100Mbps ethernet switch for TV and streamer. Since it has WIFI I was skeptical it would even work. I got a solid green light on the power line connection and a solid 130Mbps WIFI connection. It just worked. My house is 1200Sq ft, two floors. Just follow the supplied installation guide. You can't go wrong.

This is a perfect fit for the common 20W/30W/50W high-power square LED panels you see here and on other sites. Mine came with screws and thermal paste for attaching the LED. It's a little bulky but not way out of proportion to the LED.

Unfortunately, it doesn't seem to provide enough heat dissipation for a 50W LED. It might be more suitable for a 20W or 30W. With the 50W, after a few minutes of continuous operation at full power, I'm seeing the temperature at the top surface of the heat sink (nearest the LED) at about 120C, and the temperature on the LED emitter surface at 140-150C. That's too hot - the LED really needs to stay below about 50C. I think I'm going to have to look into active cooling with a fan.
target: Good fit, but doesn't seem to be enough cooling for a 50W LED

input: Only regret: The keyboard layout is bad. There is no way to turn the mouse pad off if you are using an external mouse so you will end up hitting the mouse with your palm often. The keyboard layout has the laptop-function key on the left where all standard keyboards have the control key. This means if you are a coder, etc, and are used to hitting left control-V, etc, you will find yourself messed up hitting the function key instead. The F1-F12 keys are not highlighted in white, they are in dark red making you have to physically look at the keys to see them. So for anyone who is very particular about your keyboard layout - look carefully at this first. Other than that, great laptop, easy to get rid of the pre-loaded software or simply wipe it and re-install.
target: Laptop works exactly as specified. It's a great laptop. Beware of the keyboard.

BTW, if your home button does work on android device, try to follow my step.
1. Root your android device.
2. Root Explorer </system/usr/keylayout/generic.kl>.
3. Chang the file's permissions to writable.
4. Open the file with text editor.
5. Modify the line "Key 102 MOVE_HOME" to "Key 102 HOME"
6. Save your file and reboot your device.
7. All done.

input: It is cheap and works fine with my old laptop. Installation was easy with no problems. I always check amazon before ordering any item.

I do want to point out the reason that this gets a four star is because when I received it, it looked like some already opened the box. And there is a slick plastic texture on the index finger rest that tends to feel sticky. And about two weeks after I experienced a double-clicking malfunction. Also it would be nice if the kick stand would lock open so you can use it in typing land scape mode.

All in all very happy with the case and glad I went with it!

I was vigilant (or bright enough) and the language description fooled me into believing the Windows 8.1 screen was a touch screen. It was not. I foolishly believed that the SDD hard drive storage would make it faster than my five year old current laptop: it did not.

The entire reason I bought this l laptop (from another site for reasons I won't mention) was to play older games. Sims 3, skyrim, splinter cell, etc...  I have an Xbox One so I wasn't looking to play ultra modern games on the laptop. It handles everything perfectly on ultra high settings. Beautiful display. Windows 10 looks great on it. Definately recommend IF you want to play older stuff

Between the clips and the small straps on the upper and lower right sides of the cover, my Kindle fits very securely in the cover.  Now, I don't leave home without it!  And I am eagerly awaiting the M-edge book light that will fit inside the cover and make it easy to read on planes, etc. A fabulous product that I recommend without hesitation.

input: I found the Life-Phorm to be very practical. I've used it mainly for holding and elevating my Bose Soundlink Mini Bluetooth speaker. Normally, the direction of the speaker is well below ear level when situated flat on a table but with the Life-Phorm I can direct the sound toward my head. I've attached the Life-Phorm with the speaker to a lattice in my back yard which enabled me to position the speaker at ear level when sitting on a lawn chair.  I've also used it to read my Kindle at a tilted and elevated, \\"eye friendly\\" level while I'm sitting at a desk or table. It would be perfect if they had a ratcheting device instead of a screw for locking a device into the Life-Phorm. The bottom line is, I like the multi-use Life-Phorm; its innovative, versatile and easy to manipulate. It's also a good buy at a little over $18.

Logitech kept refusing to offer local support with their "international" warranty. Last time I'm buying Logitech.

This is the second of these hard drives I've purchased and I love them.  I've never had problems with Western Digital, and the one time I did have a hard drive crash, WD has an awesome RMA program and they replaced my 320gb with one of these 500gb.  I liked it so much, that I got a second one when I got a different macbook off of Craigslist.  They are a little noisy, but that's understandable with them being 7200rpm.  Great performance, and decent battery life.  Not as quick as an SSD of course, but for those of us who value storage capacity over speed, they're great.  Much faster than the 5400rpm drive that this macbook came with.  I'm waiting for ssds to come down in price before I upgrade to one of them again because they are just too spendy per gb.  I highly recommend this drive to anyone who wants a very reliable drive that is quick and has a 5 year warranty.
Kids love them. They are 4 and 6 years old. Very user friendly and tons of kids apps to choose from. We are so glad that we made this purchase.

Recommend tape to hold the cover in place during installation and a card to help smooth out the bubbles.  There's an excellent demo for the hinge method of installation on YouTube.  Thankfully, there are three screen covers in the package, so I can try again.  I would recommend this vendor again.

I finally found a stylish and functional solution!  Everyone who sees this wants one.  It is small enough to easily manuever but at the same time has plenty of room for all of my stuff. It carries a ton of weight easily and the wheels are large and roll well even over uneven surfaces and curbs. The handle is study and doesn't twist or flex.  The side cup holder folds shut and secures with a magnet when not in use. I have never had this bag perform the dreaded side roll or tip while I am walking along.  It moves very smoothly and, a huge plus, is super quite even on tiled surfaces. The way it is made it doesn't bump into your legs while you carry it by the double strap handle. I can't think of anything that could be added to this bag to make it any more functional or attractive.  I am in love! I am planning to order another one of these just in case they ever stop making them.  The price is more than a steal when compared to other bags of MUCH less quality! If you need a rolling bag, buy this one!
target: Totally in love with this roller bag!!

input:
Unfortunately, this headset suffers from the crippling "buzzing" issue described above. There is simply no way to stop this horrific, crackling noise from constantly buzzing in your ears as you play. Razer expects you to ground your USB ports - how, by playing on the beach and immersing the PC in sand? I currently have it plugged into my PC with the mic and headphones jack, and I have the USB connected to a AC (current) to USB jack (basically what you charge a cell phone with) and IT IS STILL BUZZING.

Ultimately, you should not buy this headset. It is a joke and I totally wasted my money. Razer, you're better than this.
target: Buzzing absolutely cripples a decent headset.

input: Easy to set up.  Easy to type on.  Love it!!  The easiest computer item I have ever owned.  Why did I wait so long to get this??

Other than that, it's strong, and blows monster air. The material does feel kinda cheep though, but as long as it holds together and doesn't ever break, whatever. And do not be fooled, the screws it comes with actually does fit; you just have to apply some pressure and etch the screw into the soft plastic of the hole. Dont know why this was made this way though. Once again, the \\"ultra quiet\\" on the box is bull, this thing is quite pretty loud. But if you game on a horribly designed laptop like me, then go ahead. There might be fans that are just as strong but quieter though.

With the the negative: It appears that while in the fabrication process, the plastic was removed from the mold prior to it being completely cured. Make sure you stick with 5400rpm for the PS3 anything higher may cause you issues with glitching and overheating, 5400 is the highest and safest maxium for the PS3 to run at optimum performance. I will mention that after install of the Seagate Hard Drive I did get a little glitching and a freeze or two but after a few days of use the system broke in the Hard Drive and its been Top knotch ever since.

If your Looking into upgrading your PS3 Slim this is a high recommend!!

input:
This is regarding the Belkin F7D2102 N300 Micro Wireless N USB...

I HATE IT!

After I installed the driver and plugged in the N300, it worked for a little while then quit. I had to repeatedly go through the Windows 7 troubleshooting procedure to get it to work. It kept on failing. I removed the N300 and uninstalled the drivers from Add/Remove in Windows 7 and now my Windows networking is STILL BROKEN! The N300 screwed up my Windows 7 networking. My wireless was working fine before. I got the N300 in order to go from 150mbits to 300mbits. However, it was, rather, a setback.

Also, the seller was rather lackadaisical about putting the thing in the mail.

VERY disappointed.

--s.c.
target: Belkin F7D2102 N300 Micro Wireless N USB... I HATE IT !.

I purchased this Belkin Mini DisplayPort to HDMI Adaptor (bought at Walmart made by Belkin, not a Chinese knock-off) earlier this year, and today it stopped working. Since I put the mouse in the cradle every night, the battery stays charged. I've had no problems.     I work with a computer all day for my job and choose to play computer games in my free time. A cheap, uncomfortable mouse is a torture device. If not this mouse, at least get an optical mouse with decent resolution. This mouse is expensive even with the rebate, but if you use it hours a day almost every day...

Background. I have small hands and Logitech mice always work much better than Microsoft mice for me.

Pros:
1. Excellent tracking -- much much better than standard optical, especially on tough surfaces.
2. Higher dpi -- must compensate by slowing mouse down in software.
3. Price -- reasonable at under $20.

Cons:
A. Mouse is generally too high -- considerably higher than the other Logitech mice I have.
B. Ergonomic hump is bad -- other Logitech mice have a hump in the middle of the mouse, but this one has it on the front-edge -- clearly a bad design feature. This forces my wrist into a higher position.
C. Not as comfortable for long use -- but with a mouse pad, works out better.

input: I've been using this case for quite a long time now; a couple of years or more.  I've always been pleased with the case's appearance, fit, and quality.  Unfortunately I can't quite say the same for the feel of the case in my hand.  Other folks may not have the same problem, but I find that the case still feels too slippery in my hand, or at least more than I like or expected -- even on the black rubberized parts.  I can't use as light a grip as I'd like, for fear the tablet will still slip out of my hand.  Granted, it's much better than holding the tablet with no case at all, but I'd still like a "cushy-er" feel -- softer, thicker rubber with more grip.

This is a high quality metal case to protect your BeagleBone Black.  All cutouts are aligned accurately with the board, for example the microSD slot has very little clearance but the card can be inserted without touching the enclosure.  This is not a sealed case, but provides small slits through which to view the various onboard status LED indicators.  Knockouts are provided for a DB9 connector (9 pin serial / VGA) and a round pushbutton / indicator; the DB9 could be used for connection to internal IO pins (which provides a more finished look than an opening for a ribbon cable would).  Drawings are available on the manufacturer's web site.  Recommended for the "finished project" rather than active experimentation.
target: Recommended for the "finished project" rather than active experimentation

Even though it was refurbished, I was not leery because I had bought so many great items from Warehouse Deals before.  I only set up the computer a few days ago.  I love the computer.  Unfortunately, it contains a  counterfeit copy of Windows 7.  I ended up having to buy a new genuine copy from Microsoft yesterday.  My bargain was not a bargain, and I am furious with myself for not getting it up and running when I got it.  That is my own darned fault, but at my advanced age, I am still relearning the old advice that you get what you pay for.  All that being said. I will repeat that I love the computer.  It was a breeze to set up, and I love the cordless keyboard and mouse.  I will love it completely when I get real Windows 7 installed!

I bought the Antec USB-Powered Notebook Cooler on the basis of the reviews available at the time. And it probably was the best available then. But at best it could keep my laptop from getting hot, not cool it down if it already was. And the fans tended to get dirty and vibrate, creating a racket. I'd have to apologize for using it in quiet settings—so much so that I sometimes just used it as a stand to create room for air to circulate beneath my 15-inch MacBook Pro on its own. For information about a cooling pad that is quiet, unobtrusive, and will not only keep your laptop from heating up but also cool a hot laptop down while you continue to use it, see my review of Logitech's Cooling Pad N200. Now that's a 5-star product!

So Comcast decides to charge $5 a month for their modem that I have had for 7 years... bye, bye comcast. I had this all setup next to my old modem and connected directly to my laptop-- don't leave your switch or router in the network as it will take the tech longer as they explain to you to remove them. Just go from cable to modem to PC then call the tech and give him the MAC address that you have already copied off the bottom of the modem. Took 5 minutes. Barry-O could do it. Now my cable bill is $5 less and in 12 months I turn a $5 profit. No change in download, but upload speed doubled to 3mb/s.

To answer the other comment/reviewer, a PSP is the Sony Playstation Portable. They were released here in the USA in March 2005. It was released in Japan late 2004. Not sure about the rest of the world. The PSP uses memory stick duo media for a variety of purposes, most noteably video, music, and game data.

As far as the product, Sandisk products have been great and I've never seen any compatibility issues with Sandisk versus Sony media, so go for the best price. However, if you have a digital camera that supports high speed transfers, you might want to get the Red Sony High Speed since it supports that high speed transfers. To my knowledge, only Sony, not Sandisk, makes the high speed transfer version. However, from what I understand for PSP usage, you do not need the high speed; although, you can use the high speed in a PSP from what I've read. It could make transfers using a card reader quicker even if not the actual accesses with the PSP.

Magic!

Can not see any difference between using the wall charger and this wireless unit with my Nexus 7 2013. The unit will even charge while my Nexus 7 is still in its MoKo Google New Nexus 7 FHD 2nd Gen Case.

One of the things that I think is great, is that using this unit will help keep the wear and tear on the micro usb plug down by eliminating the need to plug in th charging cord to charge every day. I also have the 2012 Nexus 7 and the power/usb port is getting a tad sloppy from the need to charge it every day for the last year of use. Unfortunately the original Nexus 7 can not use this wireless charger but it will help prevent my new one from suffering the same wear and tear on the usb/charger port.

Highly recommended!
Gets the job done. I use it for my PS4 and I haven't had a major problem yet. 4 stars.
